Appellation: Carneros, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is a stunner from blocks planted in 1997 and 1999. Beautiful aromas of toasted hazelnut and stone lead to a palate that shows undeniable minerality paired with lasting acidity. It shows freshness and energy throughout. Drink 2026–2032.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Ramey 2018 Hyde Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This wine is a testament to an outstanding site in the hands of an outstanding producer. It is a celebration of fresh Meyer lemon and Gravenstein apple woven against an elegant structure and quenching acidity.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Ramey 2018 Rochioli Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Quenchingly fresh, complex and structured, this wine balances lushness and rounded edges of richness with vibrant acidity and length. From the producer's own 75-acre ranch, this vintage comes from a block planted in 1989. Gravenstein apple, pear and a note of nutmeg accent a stony texture of graceful tension.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Ramey 2018 Westside Farms Estate Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From older plantings on a wide-spaced site—one the producer has worked with for some time—this wine is complicated and wild, combining rich, elegant flavors of salty sea breeze with ginger and lemon puree. Seamless and supple, it has a backbone of structure and lively acidity that pair effortlessly with the apple and pear.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Ramey 2018 Ritchie Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From a site in the heart of the appellation farmed by the Martinelli family, from cuttings that can be traced back to Hyde Vineyard, this white dazzles in salty sea air, oyster shell and hay, with subdued richness and layers of Gravenstein apple and pear. The acidity drives it into a fresh array of tension and texture.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Ramey 2018 Woolsey Road Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: An incredible showcase for the appellation, this combines grapes from the producer's estate Westside Farms with Dutton, Woolsey Road and Rochioli Allen, among others. Together it is broadly floral, earthy and richly integrated, with depth and complexity, the acidity vibrantly fresh.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Ramey 2018 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Scrumptious pretty much sums it up. This rare reserve—the winery's first since 1999—honors its 30th vintage. Plush malolactic and new barrel flavors abound: buttered popcorn, brioche, apple pie and lemon custard in a big pile. It's smooth and rich and nicely balanced, though more for near-term drinking than long-term aging.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Argyle 2017 Reserve Chardonnay (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Eola-Amity Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Deeply extracted flavors of Meyer lemon, apple and peach are cloaked in lighter touches of new oak. Some 20% of the barrels were new, and the wine spent about a year and a half aging prior to bottling in March 2020. The wine soaks in deliciously, completely coating the palate and lingering down and through an extended finish with hints of butter and roasted peanuts.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Lavinea 2018 Elton Vineyard Chardonnay (Eola-Amity Hills)

Appellation: Chassagne-Montrachet, Burgundy, France
Description: On the slope south of the village of Chassagne-Montrachet, this vineyard is in the heart of the line of premier crus. This wine is textured, shot through with minerality and ripe fruits. Toast and spice give extra richness and soften the still-young acidity. The wine is still maturing, so wait to drink until 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Coffinet-Duvernay 2018 Les Fairendes Premier Cru  (Chassagne-Montrachet)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Wet stone, damp earth and woolly aromas are lifted by lemon pith on the intriguing, minerali-driven nose of this single-vineyard expression. The palate is framed by a fantastically tense structure, presenting crisp, bright and stony flavors of rainy cement, yuzu peel and grapefruit pith.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Madson 2019 Toyon Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: Chablis, Burgundy, France
Description: From arguably the grandest of the Chablis Grand Crus, this wine has dense richness, pure white fruits and the lightest touches of wood aging. The wine is well balanced, with fruitiness that contrasts with the mineral, tight texture. Age this wine and drink from 2024.                      Roger Voss
Name: Defaix Frères 2019 Les Clos Grand Cru  (Chablis)

Appellation: Chehalem Mountains, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This is a very fine effort—detailed, balanced and powerful. The fruit mix artfully conjures up ripe pear, peach, apricot and papaya, lightly spiced. The wine gains weight and length through the palate, adding a wash of nut butter during a long, lush fade.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Rex Hill 2017 Jacob-Hart Estate Vineyard Chardonnay (Chehalem Mountains)

Appellation: Chablis, Burgundy, France
Description: This is a concentrated and rich wine. With dense white-fruit flavors encased in spice and vanilla, the wine is ripe and sure to age well. It is very young and will take its time. Drink from 2024.                      Roger Voss
Name: Defaix Frères 2019 Bougros Grand Cru  (Chablis)

Appellation: Santa Maria Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Tightly wound aromas of lemon peel, citrus blossom, pomelo pith and nectarine make for a tense and engaging nose in this bottling. Fierce mineral streaks of crushed sea shell and rocks overcome the palate, where flashes of apple flesh and jicama also arise.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Tread 2019 Sierra Madre Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This delightfully memorable wine is crisp, floral and herbal, a gorgeously structured and complex expression of lengthy acidity, lemon zest and green apple. From a great cool-climate site, it captures the crisp air and ocean influence with ease.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Reeve 2018 H. Klopp Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Tight lime and Mandarin peel aromas meet with tart pear flesh on the sharp and crisp nose of this bottling. At first, the palate is driven by intense mineral flavors of chalk, and then waves of baked lemon, toast and sea salt slide in, making for complex enjoyment.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Fess Parker 2019 Ashley's Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Chablis, Burgundy, France
Description: From the coolest of the premier crus, this wine is as much about texture as fruit. Young and taut with touches of spice and a steely edge, the wine is just setting out. Drink from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Les Hauts de Milly 2019 Côte de Lechet Premier Cru  (Chablis)

Appellation: Pouilly-Fuissé, Burgundy, France
Description: From one of the terroirs of Pouilly-Fuissé that became recognized as a cru from the 2020 vintage, this wine shows class, richness and ripe yellow fruits. It is a full wine, spicy and with room for further aging. Drink this wine from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine des Granges 2018 Vers Cras  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This dramatic wine offers a tantalizing bread-dough aroma that leads to bold flavors of toasted oak, baked apple, nutmeg and butter. Medium in body, it's wrapped in a smooth texture that also retains a tang of crisp acidity for good balance.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Carpe Diem 2018 Chardonnay (Anderson Valley)

Appellation: Chablis, Burgundy, France
Description: This wine's richness and concentration is impressive. With touches of wood aging giving spice and vanilla flavors, the wine is beautifully ripe. Yellow fruits and kiwi convey richness and a crisp, tangy aftertaste. Drink from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Defaix Frères 2019 Montée de Tonnerre Premier Cru  (Chablis)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This winery's Chardonnays have existed on their own unique plane since the days when Greg Brewer was the winemaker. There's a yogurt-like dairy kick to the nose alongside orange peel, dried pear and sea salt. The palate is zesty with acidity and loaded with a range of citrus-peel and pith flavors plus a flash of guava, with a grippy texture pushing into the zippy finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Melville 2018 Estate Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: With a rich, dense and fruity nose of baked pear and tropical crème brûlée, this wine is broadly fleshy and lush, with underlying crispness that contrasts and keeps it effortlessly fresh. The bottle is incredibly heavy, but the wine is nicely light.                      Virginie Boone
Name: The Calling 2018 Sullivan Vineyard Dutton Ranch Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Chassagne-Montrachet, Burgundy, France
Description: Close to the village, this vineyard has produced a rich, full wine, layering acidity with toast, and freshness with ripe yellow fruits. The well-structured wine is marked with chiseled freshness and still maturing. Drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Coffinet-Duvernay 2018 Les Blanchots Dessous  (Chassagne-Montrachet)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This bottling begins with an intriguing yogurt note and then shifts into lemon curd, wet cement and crushed oyster shells on a fascinating, maritime-like line. That mix of tart dairy and crushed sea shells is also redolent throughout the palate, where lemongrass and key-lime-pith flavors add depth.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Madson 2018 Les Enfants de Soleil Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Tightly woven aromas of Meyer lemon peel, a hint of hard nectarine and the lightest brush of butter show on the nose of this bottling from the first spot to plant Chardonnay in the region. There's a great grip to the sip, where fresh citrus and stone-fruit flavors are wrapped in racy acidity and hints of stone and toast.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Fess Parker 2019 Sanford & Benedict Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Seductive aromas of caramel and toast lead to buttery, apple-tart flavors on a medium body. This wine is nicely freshened by good green-apple acidity and stays relatively light in texture. Fermented by native yeast and aged in just 12% new oak, it is built for aging. Best from 2024.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Drew 2018 Bahl Briney Chardonnay (Anderson Valley)

Appellation: Los Carneros, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Description: Barrel-fermented and given nearly a year in 20% new oak, this white is ripe in apple and pear flavors, with an underlying richness of crème brûlée and flan. Lengthy and complex, it has measured lushness that gets a lift from crisp acidity.                      Virginie Boone
Name: RD 2019 Hundred Knot Chardonnay (Los Carneros)

Appellation: Arroyo Seco, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Lemon blossom, nectarine, damp sand and the lightest touch of butter make for a compelling nose. It's very racy on the palate, with a brisk lemon-juice flavor that cuts through the rounded tones of nectarine and apricot.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Scott Family 2018 Dijon Clone Chardonnay (Arroyo Seco)

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Description: This full-bodied, robust wine sports toasted oak and browned butter aromas followed by ripe Bosc pear and toasted almond flavors on a rich, mouthfilling texture. It is big and well balanced, offering lots of flavor along with appetizing structure.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Buena Vista 2018 Eleanora's Selection Chardonnay (North Coast)

Appellation: Ribbon Ridge, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Sourced from the Armstrong Vineyard atop Ribbon Ridge, this is an expressive wine with compelling minerality. The citrus fruits are tart and complex, running the gamut from lemon to grapefruit to orange. It's a sappy, tangy, textured, low alcohol style with a pleasing, lingering snap to the finish.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Red Electric 2018 Evening Primrose Chardonnay (Ribbon Ridge)

Appellation: Bourgogne Côte d’Or, Burgundy, France
Description: From vines on the edge of Puligny-Montrachet, this wine has a good pedigree. Fermented in wood, it has a toasty character that promises well for the future. Vanilla and spice go with fresh kiwi and apple flavors. Drink the wine from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Jean Chartron 2019 Chardonnay  (Bourgogne Côte d’Or)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Meyer lemon peel, white peach and a chalky tone show on the nose of this county blend—a new offering from Zaca Mesa. The palate is tense and loaded with lemon peel, nectarine and sea salt flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Tread 2019 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Chehalem Mountains, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Sourced from Dick Erath's 1968 planting, this shows the power and precision of old vine fruit, along with unique clones from Mount Eden and Calera. A wonderful time-travel wine, this mixes green apple, citrus and green melon fruit with softer flavors from aging in once-used French oak.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Averaen 2019 Flood Line Chardonnay (Chehalem Mountains)

Appellation: Pouilly-Fuissé, Burgundy, France
Description: A sumptuous and tropical-fruit-flavored wine, this is ripe and densely textured. A touch of the minerality of Pouilly-Fuissé is almost overwhelmed by the concentrated fruitiness. Drink the wine from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château de Lavernette 2018 Vers Châne  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

Appellation: Chassagne-Montrachet, Burgundy, France
Description: With rich fruits and a good balance between freshness and toastiness, this wine is subtle in its complexities. White-fruit and apple flavors give the wine a concentrated character, sliced with acidity and spice. Drink from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Coffinet-Duvernay 2018  Chassagne-Montrachet

Appellation: Pouilly-Fuissé, Burgundy, France
Description: Wood aging in large and small barrels has given this ripe, young wine extra richness. With its full spice and touches of yellow fruits the wine should age well. Drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine des Granges 2019  Pouilly-Fuissé

Appellation: Santa Maria Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Lean and rocky on the nose at first, this steadily picks up warmer aromas of Pink Lady apple while retaining the wet stone and sea-shell sense. The palate grips with tight, crushed rock minerality, offering toasted almond warmth as a counterpoint.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Scar of the Sea 2019 Vino de los Ranchos Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

Appellation: Chablis, Burgundy, France
Description: This freshest of the premier cru vineyards has produced a very crisp wine. Ripe yellow fruits and red apples show through spice and touches of vanilla. This wine is young and will be best from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Defaix Frères 2019 Côte de Lechet Premier Cru  (Chablis)

Appellation: Chalone, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Pure yet restrained aromas of white peach, butterscotch and sea salt make for an inviting entry to the nose of this bottling from a single block and clone. The palate is full in body, comforting yet not over the top, offering white peach and baked pear as well as cinnamon, hazelnut and crème brûlée flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Armida 2018 Chalone Vineyard Chardonnay (Chalone)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Very stony and chalky on the nose, this appellation blend offers light Asian pear, jicama, lime blossom and lemongrass on the nose. There's tremendous grip to the palate, framing otherwise delicate hints of Meyer lemon and brisk apple that ride laser-sharp acidity into the finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Tread 2019 Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Chablis, Burgundy, France
Description: This premier cru from a cool vineyard site offers ripe fruit intensity and a richness to the texture. Despite the roundness, it still remains crisp and spicy, aided by a touch of vanilla. Drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Defaix Frères 2018 Côte de Lechet Premier Cru  (Chablis)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: The impact of the pandemic on the wine industry has led more than a few top-tier wineries to offer exceptional wines at bargain prices (relative to their past catalog). Here's one—a compendium of Willamette Valley grapes in a sculpted, vivid, sappy and accessible Chardonnay. Well-balanced apple, citrus, melon and white peach fruit are nicely ripened, blended and balanced. Drink now and over the next half decade.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Walter Scott 2019 La Combe Verte Chardonnay (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This line of wine by Bibiana González Rave punches above its weight. This bottling starts with aromas of tight pear, jasmine, white rose and Pink Lady apple on the nose. The palate is very tight in structure, yet delivers joyous white-flower flavors and racy acidity.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Alma de Cattleya 2019 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Santa Lucia Highlands, Central Coast, California, US
Description: There's a light touch of butter and macadamia nut on the nose of this bottling, which warms up the baked lemon and stony aromas. The palate is wrapped in a chalky tension, delivering flavors of lemon glaze, toasted apple and a rugged, sandstone-like minerality.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: I. Brand & Family 2018 Escolle Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Spicy, toasty oak overtones blend well with ample notes of pear and baked apple in this full-bodied wine. It's not shy on the wood char, butter and vanilla elements, and matches them with delicious fruit and a mouthfilling texture that encourages a long finish.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Lava Cap 2019 Estate Chardonnay (El Dorado)

Appellation: Van Duzer Corridor, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Made using the black Chardonnay method that is intentionally hyper-oxidized prior to fermenting, this wine is crisp in snappy apple and persimmon fruit. It was aged 14 months in half new French oak, softening the mouthfeel and adding pleasant notes of toast and butter.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Coelho 2018 Coelho Vineyard Chardonnay (Van Duzer Corridor)

Appellation: Mâcon-Fuissé, Burgundy, France
Description: A rich, well-textured wine, this has sophistication and ripeness. Touches of wood aging bring out the up-front apple and peach flavors as well as the tight mineral edge. Drink this wine from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Rijckaert 2018 Vieilles Vignes  (Mâcon-Fuissé)

Appellation: Bourgogne, Burgundy, France
Description: Based in Meursault this producer is a white-wine specialist. This release shows good balance between wood aging, ripe acidity and peppered apple flavors. The wine has richness while keeping a fresh edge. Drink from late 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Vincent Girardin 2018 Cuvée Saint-Vincent  (Bourgogne)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A welcome blend of toasty, flinty and buttery aromas leads to rather rich and generous pear and baked apple flavors. A full body and softish acidity let it relax on the palate.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Darcie Kent Vineyards 2018 DeMayo Vineyard Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Arroyo Seco, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Peach blossom, warm buttercream and Nilla wafer aromas make for an invitingly rich nose on this bottling. The palate grabs attention with a lemon-pith grip, as white-peach lushness battles with an alkaline minerality, making for a flavorful yet not overdone expression.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Kendall-Jackson 2019 Jackson Estate Seco Highlands Chardonnay (Arroyo Seco)

Appellation: Bourgogne, Burgundy, France
Description: This Meursault-based producer obviously understands Chardonnay because this wine is exemplary in its ripeness, smooth fruits and tight edge of acidity. The wine has richness, white fruits and hints of vanilla as well as attractive spiciness. Drink this wine now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Buisson Battault 2018 Les Magnys  (Bourgogne)

Appellation: Bourgogne, Burgundy, France
Description: This rich wine offers ripe yellow fruits and touches of vanilla. Along with its warm feeling and light acidity, it has a perfumed character that makes it exciting as well as drinkable.                      Roger Voss
Name: Maison Roche de Bellene 2018 Cuvée Réserve Chardonnay  (Bourgogne)

Appellation: Edna Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Clean lines of buttercream, honeysuckle, lemon peel and light almond are toasty but fresh on the nose of this bottling. There is ample tension on the palate, which begins with a flash of acidic energy and crushed sea shell before delivering the richer flavors of baked pear, toasted almond and light butterscotch.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Biddle Ranch 2018 Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

Appellation: Monterey County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This is a remarkable wine for the price, starting with warm aromas of peach, sea salt, macadamia nut and Meyer lemon peel. The palate is round in apple and orange rind flavors that accompany a buttercream and honeysuckle core. Bright acidity sparkles into the finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Golden 2019 Chardonnay (Monterey County)

Appellation: Los Carneros, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Description: With a crisp entry of oyster shell, Meyer lemon and high-toned acidity, this wine remains bright and vibrant in the glass, with a bite of juicy green apple and well-integrated oak. It shows complexity and structure within its lively framework of balance and length.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Vine Cliff 2019 Chardonnay (Los Carneros)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Aromas of salted nuts, dried lemon rind, orange peel, white peach and oak show on the nose of this bottling. The toasty qualities consume the sip, where baked apple and baking spice flavors meet with prevalent wood spice.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Fess Parker 2019 Parker West Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Santa Maria Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Light aromas of gardenia and nectarine ride waves of soft cream on the nose of this single-vineyard expression. There's firm tension to the palate, with lime and grapefruit-peel flavors, as more broad honeysuckle and orange-flesh flavors emerge toward the finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Fess Parker 2019 Sierra Madre Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

Appellation: Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Beaune, Burgundy, France
Description: An estate west of the Côte Chalonnaise has produced this ripe, wood-aged wine. It is young, but it has good potential, with rich yellow fruits and tightly crisp citrus. The fruit flavors, mineral texture and vanilla from the wood make this a fine wine for aging. Drink from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Antonin Rodet 2019 Château de Mercey Chardonnay  (Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Beaune)

Appellation: Bourgogne Côte d’Or, Burgundy, France
Description: Aged in wood for a year, this is a fresh, perfumed wine. Touches of the wood aging show in a toasty, vanilla edge while the wine also has a crisp texture and attractive lemon flavors. Drink the wine from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Albert Bichot 2019 Sécret de Famille  (Bourgogne Côte d’Or)

Appellation: Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Nuits, Burgundy, France
Description: This single-vineyard wine has good tension, with minerality and acidity to go with crisp white fruits. The wine has depth and the potential to age further. Drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Thevenot-le-Brun 2018 Clos du Vignon  (Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Nuits)

Appellation: Santa Maria Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Light aromas of gardenia and nectarine ride waves of soft cream on the nose of this single-vineyard expression. There's firm tension to the palate, with lime and grapefruit-peel flavors, as more broad honeysuckle and orange-flesh flavors emerge toward the finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Fess Parker 2019 Sierra Madre Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Production has bumped up on this fine example of Willamette Valley Chardonnay, which means greater availability and perhaps the inclusion of grapes previously intended for pricier cuvées. It's a smooth and polished wine, with a buttery mouthfeel though not excessive butter flavors. Look for a fresh mix of tree fruits and a lick of caramel through the finish.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Soléna 2019 Chardonnay (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Mâcon-Lugny, Burgundy, France
Description: Delicious apple and white-peach flavors give this wine intense freshness as well as acidity. A touch of minerality adds complexity to this fruity, refreshing wine. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Louis Jadot 2018 Domaine du Bouchet  (Mâcon-Lugny)

Appellation: Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Nuits, Burgundy, France
Description: This estate in Nuits Saint-Georges has 2.4 acres of Chardonnay in the midst of the Pinot Noir. The result is this ripe, full-bodied and fruity wine. It is already delicious, but promises more. Good acidity and a taut, mineral texture will age well. Drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaines Devillard 2018 Domaine des Perdrix Chardonnay  (Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Nuits)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Fresh and bracing, this apparently lightly oaked, medium-bodied wine won't get heavy after a glass full. It emphasizes lemon, lime and green-apple flavors and a crisp texture that's mouthwatering. Best from 2023.                      Jim Gordon
Name: FEL 2019 Chardonnay (Anderson Valley)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Rounded white-peach aromas are toasty and warm, and a flashy lemon glaze provides the acidic kick to the nose of this bottling. The citrus elements play on the sip as well, where baked apple, sea-salt and toast flavors ride a tension that grows grippier into the finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Gainey 2019 Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Bourgogne, Burgundy, France
Description: With ripe swathes of apricot allied to touches of vanilla, this wine is full and warm. It is well balanced, with lime acidity fruitiness and a tangy aftertaste. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Joseph Drouhin 2019 Laforêt Chardonnay  (Bourgogne)

Appellation: Bourgogne, Burgundy, France
Description: This bold, rich wine offers ripe peach and citrus, giving both fullness and freshness. The tension between the wine's texture and its fruits is working well. The wine is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Dominique Guyon 2018 Chardonnay  (Bourgogne)

Appellation: Arroyo Seco, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Very light in the glass, this bottling begins with aromas of dried lime, plumeria and jasmine with hints of sea shell as well. There is a decent tension to the sip, where dried Asian pear and lightly tropical guava-skin flavors arise.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Martin Ranch 2019 J.D. Hurley Griva Vineyard Chardonnay (Arroyo Seco)

Appellation: Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Nuits, Burgundy, France
Description: A ripe, creamy wine rich in white fruits, this is already delicious but could well age further. With its fresh edge and bright acidity, it has a mineral texture that will allow it to age. Drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château de Laborde 2018 Cuvée K  (Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Nuits)

Appellation: Bourgogne Côte d’Or, Burgundy, France
Description: From vines in the Côte de Beaune region, this ripe wine is full of apricot and rich apple flavors. A smooth vanilla texture brings out the wine's warmth while leaving room for freshness at the end. Drink the wine now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Patrick Javillier 2018 Cuvée des Forgets  (Bourgogne Côte d’Or)

Appellation: Saint-Romain, Burgundy, France
Description: This ripe, wood-aged wine brings together spice, rich white fruits and a slash of oakiness. A fresh edge balances the warm fruits and creamy aftertaste. Drink the wine from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Henri Latour et Fils 2019 Le Jarron  (Saint-Romain)

Appellation: Saint-Romain, Burgundy, France
Description: This ripe, wood-aged wine brings together spice, rich white fruits and a slash of oakiness. A fresh edge balances the warm fruits and creamy aftertaste. Drink the wine from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Henri Latour et Fils 2019 Le Jarron  (Saint-Romain)

Appellation: Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Nuits, Burgundy, France
Description: Partly wood fermented and aged, this wine is rich, spicy and ripe. Creamy although also offering plenty of acidity, the wine is well textured. Orange zest and a nervy edge give freshness and structure. The wine will soften well, so drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Manuel Olivier 2018 Chardonnay  (Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Nuits)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: White melon, white peach, butterscotch and sea salt make for quite an opulent nose on this bottling. There's a creamy, fleshy mouthfeel to the full-bodied palate, with buttercream and caramel flavors that are cut by lemon zest.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Comartin 2019 R-Bar-R Ranch Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: Mâcon Solutré, Burgundy, France
Description: Young with fruitiness that is beginning to develop, this wine is going to be ripe. Apricot and mango flavors give a tropical feel to the texture. Drink this attractive wine from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Trouillet 2019  Mâcon Solutré

Appellation: Bourgogne, Burgundy, France
Description: From a negociant based in Beaune, this wine offers ripe, spicy fruits, with apple and toast flavors lifted by good acidity. It is full bodied but refreshing. Drink from late 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Maison Champy 2019 Cuvée Edme Chardonnay  (Bourgogne)

Appellation: Mâcon-Loché, Burgundy, France
Description: This wine is soft, with spice from wood aging balancing with crisp apple and a light, zingy orange-zest flavor. The wine balances a breath of fresh air with riper fruits. Drink now. Biodynamic.                      Roger Voss
Name: Marcel Couturier 2018 Climat Les Longues Terres  (Mâcon-Loché)

Appellation: Mâcon-Loché, Burgundy, France
Description: This wine is soft, with spice from wood aging balancing with crisp apple and a light, zingy orange-zest flavor. The wine balances a breath of fresh air with riper fruits. Drink now. Biodynamic.                      Roger Voss
Name: Marcel Couturier 2018 Climat Les Longues Terres  (Mâcon-Loché)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Fermented and aged entirely in stainless steel, this white is indeed crisp, clean and focused in style, with a vervy acidity that persists across a lithe palate of white flower, oyster shell and green apple. It doesn't suffer from the lack of oak, providing enough mouthfeel and buzz to stay lively and lengthy.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Keltom Roots 2019 Unoaked Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Oak Knoll District, Napa, California, US
Description: A rich, creamy and oak-driven white, this medium-bodied effort shows a wealth of pineapple, mango and toasted oak flavor. Meaty and floral, it reveals contrast and complexity across a wide palate.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Materra Cunat Family Vineyards 2018 Chardonnay (Oak Knoll District)

Appellation: Mâcon-Charnay, Burgundy, France
Description: Wholly owned by the producer, this five-acre enclave of vines is in the center of the village of Charnay. This wine is ripe, with sweet lime and bright, textured white-fruit flavors. With its mineral edge, the wine could continue aging further. Drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Designation: Le Clos de la Tournache Monopole
Name: Pascal & MIreille Renaud 2019 Le Clos de la Tournache Monopole  (Mâcon-Charnay)

Appellation: Mâcon La Roche Vineuse, Burgundy, France
Description: Named after a small creek, this wine is rich, with some toastiness as well as generous ripe yellow and apple fruits. With its mineral edge and acidity, the wine has potential. Drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Collovray et Terrier 2019 Deux Roches Sur le Fil  (Mâcon La Roche Vineuse)

Appellation: Mâcon-Lugny, Burgundy, France
Description: This full wine offers a medley of fruit flavors along with a rich, tangy texture. Generous yellow fruits partner with a vibrant aftertaste. Drink from late 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Rijckaert 2019 Les Crays vers Vaux  (Mâcon-Lugny)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: A vibrant streak of mint and clove underscores the yellow apple and banana fruit flavors of this barrel-fermented wine. Additional barrel time has polished any roughness and renders it perfectly drinkable at this young age. A proportion of the barrels were put through malolactic fermentation.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Zimri Cellars 2019 Chardonnay (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Mâcon-Vinzelles, Burgundy, France
Description: This single-vineyard wine is textured and ripe. Vines that are more than 60 years old have given low-yield concentration as well as fresh citrus flavors and a mineral texture. Drink from late 2021. Biodynamic.                      Roger Voss
Name: Marcel Couturier 2018 Climat Aux Corliers  (Mâcon-Vinzelles)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: This handsomely oaky wine shows a deep gold color and pleasant scents of nutmeg followed by lavish golden apple, vanilla and butterscotch flavors on a smooth but not heavy texture.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Ryer Estate 2019 Chardonnay (California)

Appellation: Oak Knoll District, Napa, California, US
Description: Lush and oak-driven, this has a concentrated, full-bodied foundation of apple, pear and pineapple flavors that give it flesh and weight across a lengthy palate. Secondary notes of vanilla, baking spice and crème caramel add to the richness and breadth of the wine, with underlying acidity that refreshes.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Beringer 2018 Luminus Chardonnay (Oak Knoll District)

Appellation: Oak Knoll District, Napa, California, US
Description: A creamy canned-pineapple flavor meets light oak accents in this medium-bodied white. It is rounded in feel yet shows a balanced sense of richness, with crisp acidity balancing against the weight.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Materra Cunat Family Vineyards 2019 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Oak Knoll District)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Rich in salty caramel crème brûlée, this is a fleshy and lushly made white wine, full bodied and concentrated in style. The oak provides a foundation of toasty baking spice and vanilla.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Buena Vista 2018 Private Reserve Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This full-bodied and subtly spicy wine balances attractive ripe apple and pear flavors against bright acidity as light accents of vanilla, butter and toast heighten the palate. It is polished and complete.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Lava Cap 2019 Reserve Chardonnay (El Dorado)

Appellation: Mâcon-Milly Lamartine, Burgundy, France
Description: Round and soft with a touch of vanilla and spice, this is a ripe wine. It offers attractive white fruits, acidity and toastiness from 12 months in barrel. Drink from late 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Louis Max 2019 Clos du Four  (Mâcon-Milly Lamartine)

Appellation: Bourgogne, Burgundy, France
Description: With 12 months in wood, this soft, ripe wine offers toastiness alongside rich yellow-fruit and red-apple flavors. Already refreshingly juicy, it will be even better from late 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château du Cray 2019 Chardonnay  (Bourgogne)

Appellation: Mâcon Solutré, Burgundy, France
Description: This wine comes from two parcels of old vines that give concentration and spiciness. It is a ripe wine, showing warmth as well as a bright texture. Drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine du Roc des Boutires 2019  Mâcon Solutré

Appellation: Los Carneros, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Description: A barrel-fermented white from the cooler-climate appellation, this wine offers fleshy, floral and soft layers of anise, pineapple and white peach. The oak is integrated and contributes additional structure and spice tones.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Silverado 2019 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Los Carneros)

Appellation: Pouilly-Fuissé, Burgundy, France
Description: With its baked-apple flavors, smooth texture and ripe acidity, this wine is just ready to drink. The rich texture is comfortably balanced by acidity and the tight final texture.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château de Lavernette 2018 Cuvée Jean-Jacques de Boissieu  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

Appellation: Mâcon-Lugny, Burgundy, France
Description: This is a ripe, complex and rich wine. It shows a textured mix of taut fruitiness and youthful acidity. It is good for aging over the medium term. Drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Joseph Drouhin 2019 Les Crays  (Mâcon-Lugny)

Appellation: Bourgogne Côtes d’Auxerre, Burgundy, France
Description: Rounded, rich and softly textured, this wine is immediately very drinkable. Bright acidity contrasts with the wine's richness and gives a crisp aftertaste. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Felix 2018 Chardonnay  (Bourgogne Côtes d’Auxerre)

Appellation: Bourgogne, Burgundy, France
Description: Lightly oak aged, this wine has spice and attractive, judicious toastiness. With a good streak of freshness along with rich white fruits, the wine offers a ripe aftertaste. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Henri de Villamont 2018 Prestige Chardonnay  (Bourgogne)

Appellation: Mâcon-Loché, Burgundy, France
Description: This 13th-century castle is surrounded by a 27-acre vineyard that delivers a tangy, fruity wine with great freshness. It has richness as well, the ripe apple and white-stone-fruit flavors balanced with the texture. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Collin-Bourisset 2018 Château de Loché Chardonnay  (Mâcon-Loché)

Appellation: Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Nuits, Burgundy, France
Description: Touches of vanilla and spice give this wine a ripe feel, balancing crisp green and citrus fruits and the acidity. This delicious wine has a perfumed, mineral aftertaste. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Aegerter 2018 Les Petites Corvées  (Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Nuits)

Appellation: Bourgogne Côte d’Or, Burgundy, France
Description: Lightly wood aged, this wine offers toastiness as well as peach and mango flavors. It comes from a single vineyard belonging to this medieval chateau in the south of the Côte d'Or. The wine is rich and full in the mouth, with ripe acidity. Drink from late 2021.                      Roger Voss
Designation: Clos de la Chaise Dieu Monopole
Name: Château de Santenay 2018 Clos de la Chaise Dieu Monopole  (Bourgogne Côte d’Or)

Appellation: Los Carneros, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Description: This wine was given 16 months in 65% new French oak—an imprint that plays prominently on the palate. Full-bodied and concentrated flavors of pineapple, pear and fig add to the weight and power of the wine, ending in a flourish of nutmeg and vanilla.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Vine Cliff 2019 Proprietress Reserve Chardonnay (Los Carneros)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: This sturdy, enjoyable and full-bodied wine blends its tasty toast, butter and vanilla notes with rich pear flavors and slightly tangy acidity for good balance.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Leese-Fitch 2019 Chardonnay (California)

Appellation: Mâcon-Vinzelles, Burgundy, France
Description: This textured, mineral wine offers good acidity and plenty of fresh apple and citrus fruits. It also has spice, vanilla and a tight structure that will soften. Drink the wine from late 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Collin-Bourisset 2018 Château de Loché Chardonnay  (Mâcon-Vinzelles)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: Ripe apples, vanilla and spice come together in this fruity wine. Acidity and touches of minerality add an attractive texture to contrast with the freshness. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Guillaman 2020 Chardonnay (Côtes de Gascogne)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: This carbonated Chardonnay is well-balanced in juiced pear and apple flavors, with a gentle perlage and tangy citrus lifting it all up. There's good expansion to all the fruit flavors, making this a tasty straightforward bubbly.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Stony Lonesome 2019 Sec Carbonated Chardonnay (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This full-bodied and full-flavored wine offers heady aromas of toasted baguette, vanilla and butter, while delivering lush pear and yellow-peach flavors on a smooth, rich texture. It's oaky and assertive.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Gen5 2018 Chardonnay (Lodi)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: This smooth and soft wine shows nicely ripe pears and vanilla plus a touch of butter on a rounded texture. It is mouthfilling, fruity and not obviously oaky.                      Jim Gordon
Name: First & Local 2019 Chardonnay (California)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: This light-bodied wine offers pears galore, lightly accented by butter, ginger and nutmeg. Mouthfilling, fruity and a touch soft, it will be a crowd-pleaser.                      Jim Gordon
Name: 101 North NV Chardonnay (California)

Appellation: South Eastern Australia, Australia Other, Australia
Description: This is an excellent bottling of Penfolds's most premium Chard. It offers drinkability now with the promise of a long life ahead. Always a polished, rich style, this vintage deftly balances the barrel and lees characters of oyster shell and nougat with notes of fresh lemon and peach. The palate is linear and focused with a lovely lift of saline acidity, chalky texture and a long salt-and-lemon finish. Drink now–2031, at least.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Penfolds 2018 Yattarna Bin 144 Chardonnay (South Eastern Australia)

Appellation: Santa Lucia Highlands, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A bold chalky aroma melds with Asian pear, Tuscan melon and light brushes of yuzu and Meyer lemon in this wine. The palate grabs hold with a texture that doesn't quit, carrying flavors of lemon bar and cashew that are rich in their own sneaky way.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Caraccioli 2018 Escolle Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Given moderate time in French oak, just 20% of it new, this wine retains a lively freshness beneath the lush fruit. Bright notes throughout complement the rich, rewarding body of pear compote and nutmeg.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Sangiacomo 2018 Green Acres Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Tasmania, Tasmania, Australia
Description: Tolpuddle has quickly risen in the ranks to become one of Australia's most renowned single vineyards. The Chard is a rich, polished style that won't be for everyone, but is still all class. Reductive notes of oyster shell and gun flint perch neatly beside baked apple, nougat and high-end oak on the nose. The palate carries out the nose's promises of richness albeit with a good deal of refreshment. (This is cool climate territory after all.). Sleek, slippery and made for the long haul (drink until 2036, at least), this is a nod to Burgundy with Tassie roots.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Tolpuddle 2019 Chardonnay (Tasmania)

Appellation: Mt. Harlan, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Light aromas of honeysuckle, sea salt, white peach and nectarine show on the nose of this classic bottling, from a 2,200-foot-high vineyard. There is a strong streak of limestone flavor to the sip, with warmer hints of white peach and toast.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Calera 2018 Chardonnay (Mt. Harlan)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Lightly buttered orange slices, warm brioche and sharp tangerine-peel aromas show on the nose of this bottling from an epic and dramatic vineyard. It's very suave on the palate, where buttered toast and marmalade flavors are framed by hints of oak and fresher citrus.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Ken Brown 2018 Radian Vineyard Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: This is an earthy, herbal and supple white wine, impressive in spicy lemon and pear. Lively, vibrant acidity keeps it fresh and compelling around mineral elements of stone as it builds a depth of balanced body weight and breadth, the oak well integrated and nuanced.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Stag's Leap Wine Cellars 2018 Arcadia Vineyard Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Creamy aromas of toasted nut met with honeysuckle, lemon peel and chiseled granite show on the nose of this block designate from vines planted at nearly 2,000 feet in 1980. It's well rounded on the palate, where flashes of tart apple and lemon peel are wrapped in sandy tannins.                      Matt Kettmann
Designation: Anna Cristina's Block Langley Hill Vineyard
Name: Thomas Fogarty 2017 Anna Cristina's Block Langley Hill Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A mix of baking and Asian spices lead the way to a light, crisp palate of vibrant acidity in this lengthy, complex and impressive white wine. The energy gives into a creamy midpalate of understated richness and fruit tones of green apple and pear.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Crescere 2017 Proprietary Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Tight aromas of Meyer lemon skin, sea salt and a hint of alkaline-dusted toast make for a compelling entry to the nose of this bottling. Polished tannins make for a very grippy yet suave sip, offering poached lemon, light brioche and macadamia nut flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Sanford 2017 Founders' Vines Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Chalone, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Recent vintages mark a return to grace for this historic property, where Winemaker Gianni Abate is bringing life back to the wines. This bottling begins with a tight citrus-peel element on the nose as well as crushed sea shell. The texture is very rocky in a pleasant way, carrying fresh flavors of yuzu peel, jicama and Asian pear.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Chalone Vineyard 2019 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Chalone)

Appellation: Hemel-en-Aarde Valley, South Africa
Description: A beautiful wine from a great vintage, aromas of sea spray, apple flesh and a touch of melon form the delicate nose of this precise Chardonnay. The palate is light and somewhat linear on entry, but then waves of ripe, lightly toasted orchard fruit and mouthwatering acidity dance across the palate and into the bright, focused finish. This is a baby, so give it more time to truly shine. Drink 2024–2029.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Name: Hamilton Russell 2019 Chardonnay (Hemel-en-Aarde Valley)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: From a vineyard planted in 1982 at an elevation of nearly 2,000 feet, this bottling begins with briny aromas of lemon and lime peel as well as a beach-sand and oyster-shell minerality, and a white-flower aspect. The palate is sharp and intense in texture, with energetic flavors of seared lemon peel and warm toast wrapped up very tightly. Drink now through 2037.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Thomas Fogarty 2017 Portola Springs Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: Hemel-en-Aarde Ridge, South Africa
Description: There's a pronounced oak overlay to the nose of this wine, with wood-grilled apple and peach pit currently at the fore. Cinnamon and sweet baking spice also abound on the nose and palate, with more flavors of baked apple tones and wood-grilled peach. All that richness aside, everything is in balance, as there's focused acidity to counter the opulence and a nice texture to the palate that carries through to the softly structured finish.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Name: Storm 2019 Ridge Chardonnay (Hemel-en-Aarde Ridge)

Appellation: Orange, New South Wales, Australia
Description: This is an affordable, energetic modern Aussie Chardy from the cool climes of the Orange region of New South Wales. There's lovely tension on the nose. It's high toned but with subtle fruit, a copper penny tang and an underbelly of ground ginger, freshly squeezed lemon and peach juice, vanilla bean and a dried herbal note. The tension carries through to the palate. It's lean but not mean, focused less on oak or lees character and more on tingly acidity and juicy fruit. One to please both the Chard and the Pinot Grigio lovers in your life.                      Christina Pickard
Name: See Saw 2019 Chardonnay (Orange)

Appellation: Walker Bay, South Africa
Description: A lovely nose of concentrated melon, toasted apple and yellow flowers leads the experience, with a soft oaky overlay of sweet spice for added decadence. The palate is medium in body but bright and pure, with focused acidity that drives through to the lingering finish with precision. It's beautifully balanced and harmonious; it'll be hard to resist now, but should mature well through 2026.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Name: Creation 2018 The Art of Chardonnay (Walker Bay)

Appellation: Orange, New South Wales, Australia
Description: This is an affordable, energetic modern Aussie Chardy from the cool climes of the Orange region of New South Wales. There's lovely tension on the nose. It's high toned but with subtle fruit, a copper penny tang and an underbelly of ground ginger, freshly squeezed lemon and peach juice, vanilla bean and a dried herbal note. The tension carries through to the palate. It's lean but not mean, focused less on oak or lees character and more on tingly acidity and juicy fruit. One to please both the Chard and the Pinot Grigio lovers in your life.                      Christina Pickard
Name: See Saw 2019 Chardonnay (Orange)

Appellation: San Luis Obispo County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dried lemon, grapefruit flesh, apple slices and lemongrass meet with steely minerality on the nose of this bottling. The sip is zesty and fresh with lime-peel and lemon flavors. A solid sea-shell minerality adds to the energetic experience.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Lightpost 2019 Spanish Springs Vineyard Reserve Chardonnay (San Luis Obispo County)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas offer notes of toast, struck flint, yellow apple and peach. The stone fruit flavors are full, layered and rich but with plenty of acidity to support them. Whereas many full-bodied Chardonnays win on texture, this one does so on its extravagant flavor.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Dusted Valley 2018 Olsen Vineyard Chardonnay (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Tightly coiled aromas of crushed limestone, grapefruit rind and lemon pith make for an appealing nose in this countywide blend. The palate shows plenty of chalky grip in line with those aromas, and the flavors soften just a bit toward Meyer lemon peel and sea salt.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Fess Parker 2019 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Light meringue and sweet cream aromas meet with floral tones of lily, plumeria and a bit of vanilla on the nose of this appellation blend. The wine grabs hold of the palate with a steely grip, offering tense while fresh flavors of lime blossom and citrus peel.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Thomas Fogarty 2017 Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: Los Carneros, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Description: Reductive at first, this wine opens to reveal floral aromas of apple blossom and earth. Crunchy and austere in style, it shows a steely structure and bright acidity throughout, cradled in a well-integrated nuance of French oak.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Vine Cliff 2018 Chardonnay (Los Carneros)

Appellation: Edna Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: There's a streak of stone on the nose of this bottling before the toasted macadamia nut, baked apricot and lemon-balm flavors come through. There's a zesty flash to the sip of lemongrass, yuzu, Mandarin peel and lime, with warmer marzipan tones on the finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Wolff 2019 Old VInes Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

Appellation: Tasmania, Tasmania, Australia
Description: This is a well-priced Chardonnay that champions the distinct character of Australia's coolest climate winegrowing region. It offers flavors of melon, peach, ginger and toasty oak nuances. It's both corpulent and refreshing, linear and crisp, with a salty mineral note adding complexity to the fleshy fruit and spice flavors.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Devil's Corner 2020 Chardonnay (Tasmania)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Aromas of baked apple with sea salt and soft, clarified butter show on the delicate nose of this bottling. The wine lands softly on the palate, where crisp Asian pear elements are layered with more baked apple and a light brush of cinnamon, all wrapped in creamy tannins.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Assiduous 2019 Bald Mountain Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is a barrel-fermented white that opens in high-toned lemon and floral apple blossom—the oak and oomph subtle despite its full-bodied ripeness. Grapefruit, green apple and toast do a good job of complementing the brightness and tang of the fruit.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Bougetz 2018 Parched Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Edna Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Hints of coconut, meringue and light nectarine make for a suavely integrated nose on this bottling. It's pure and crisp on the palate with citrus-peel and tart apple flavors, leading into warmer spices on the finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Stephen Ross 2018 Bee Sweet Vineyard Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

Appellation: Hawke's Bay, New Zealand
Description: This is a riper, more approachable vintage than the 2017 Elston. It opens with appealing notes of melon, apricot marmalade and barrel-driven butterscotch aromas. Marmalade is the dominant flavor on the full-figured palate as well, providing a pithy bite of refreshment amid a broad, slippery texture. Drink now–2026.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Te Mata 2018 Elston Chardonnay (Hawke's Bay)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: There's a distinct aroma of wet chalk, wool and even labneh on the nose of this bottling (from a vineyard planted in 1981), which begins to open to lemon and warmer cream, with patience and air. The chalky texture of the sip is incredibly compelling, framing mellow lines of lemon and melon rind. Expect these elements to coalesce into something stunning with time. Drink now through 2032.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Thomas Fogarty 2017 Albutom Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Baked pear, warm apricot brioche, toasted nuts and yuzu peel show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is rich in flavors of baked pineapple, buttered apple and warm toast lifted by just enough lemon zest and minerality to balance the marzipan finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Two Sisters 2017 Courtney's Vineyard Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Monterey, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Rich hints of lightly seared marshmallow, meringue and peach custard are cut by dried lemon peel and hazelnut aromas on the nose of this bottling. The palate is very grippy in texture, with strong lemon-peel acidity and stony minerality leading into a nuttier, butterscotch-touched finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Seabold Cellars 2018 Pelio Upper Block Chardonnay (Monterey)

Appellation: Hemel-en-Aarde Ridge, South Africa
Description: Beautifully precise aromas of orange rind, crisp yellow apple, soft toast and delicate wood spice dance on the bouquet of this lovely Chardonnay. The palate is focused and pure, with ample ripe fruit that is framed by bright, supportive acidity and a pronounced mineral impression that unfolds on the long, evolving close alongside a kiss of saline.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Name: Tesselaarsdal 2019 Chardonnay (Hemel-en-Aarde Ridge)

Appellation: Los Carneros, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Description: Opening in a wealth of baking-spice and apple-blossom aromas, this white has tingly acidity and impressive structure: the ripeness balanced and well-integrated with the oak and intensity. Old World grace comes to mind throughout, with a steely, earthy finish.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Vine Cliff 2018 Proprietress Reserve Chardonnay (Los Carneros)

Appellation: Beechworth, Victoria, Australia
Description: This is a classy example of just how far Australian Chardonnay has come over the past decade or so. From a small-but-mighty cool climate region in Victoria, it's a sturdy, mouthfilling wine with a lick of toasty oak, but it never goes overboard, neatly supporting the bright lemon, nougat and seashell characters and setting the stage for a silky-textured, cellarworthy and highly food-friendly wine. Drink now–2028.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Fighting Gully Road 2017 Smith's Vineyard Chardonnay (Beechworth)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Soft and creamy aromas of peach and apricot meet with daffodil and honeysuckle on the delicate but full nose of this bottling by actor Kurt Russell, named for his wife, Goldie Hawn. The sip is surrounded in a chalky grip, offering fresh and generous flavors of white peach and cream.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: GoGi 2018 Goldie Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Adelaide Hills, South Australia, Australia
Description: Croft neatly displays the bright, fleshy fruit of the Adelaide Hills in this polished and ageworthy-yet-drinkable Chard. There's an abundance of melon, peach and red apple aromas on the nose, and some vanilla bean, too. The palate is equally fruity and full figured, the textural roundness buoyed by bright acidity. A well-balanced wine for drinking now or until around 2029.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Henschke 2018 Croft Chardonnay (Adelaide Hills)

Appellation: Los Carneros, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Description: Named for the winery's founding family, this white is floral, textured and oak laden, with dense layers of pineapple and stone fruit. Made in a hearty, creamy style, the fruit is encased in caramel brioche and notes of nutmeg and cinnamon.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Cuvaison 2018 ATS Estate Grown Chardonnay (Los Carneros)

Appellation: Los Carneros, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Description: With an entry that is oak-driven in caramel and toast, this wine is layered and moderately structured, with fresh bursts of white peach and apple that shine a light on the underlying acidity. That freshness endures and lifts the lemony finish.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Artesa 2018 Estate Vineyard Chardonnay (Los Carneros)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Made in a lush style with a broad, appealing fleshiness and velvety texture, this wine shows off the vineyard well, mixing cool coastal components of acidity and minerality with California richness. Pineapple, pear and baking spice dominate around notes of oak and flint.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Fulcrum 2018 Durell Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Mount Veeder, Napa, California, US
Description: Floral, this wine is intensely full bodied and spicy in oak, with strong, full-bodied flavors of Gravenstein apple, Meyer lemon and pear. The mountain appellation imparts dry, prominent tannins and an enduring earthiness.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Hess Collection 2018 Small Block Chardonnay (Mount Veeder)

Appellation: Walker Bay, South Africa
Description: This smells quite rich and opulent, with aromas of creamed melon, buttered nuts and baked apples on the nose. The mouthfeel is round and rich, with sweet oak spice and a baked apple flavor that are met by a cut of citrus-tinged acidity and a delicately pithy texture. The medium-length finish shows good evolution, ending with an impression of toasted whole spice.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Name: Creation 2018 Reserve Chardonnay (Walker Bay)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Tangy lemon and Mandarin aromas meet with a core of buttered apricot on the nose of this bottling. There's a firm tension to the sip, where toasted nut, sea salt and citrus peel flavors are enhanced by a crushed seashell minerality.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Lincourt 2017 Rancho Santa Rosa Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This wine opens in a whirl of tropical-fruit cup, olive juice and sweet oak, evolving in the glass to reveal a fleshy, lush texture of rounded richness. The tannin structure provides an impressive foundation.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Fritz Underground 2017 Reserve Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Carneros, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Description: With a mineral-like stone character, this white is edgy in floral and earthy components that accent a robust, full-bodied style etched in oak and caramel. The fruit is richly layered pear and peach, with a side note of papaya, accentuating the overall richness of the wine.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Poundstone 2018 Sangiacomo Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)

Appellation: Edna Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Bright on the nose with fresh lime blossoms, lemon-zest, crisp nectarine and light oyster-shell aromas, this is a solid appellation blend by veteran Stephen Ross Dooley. A pithy grip frames the sip, where richer hints of browned butter and dried apple emerge against the brisk citrus elements.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Stephen Ross 2018 Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

Appellation: Los Carneros, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Description: With a buttery, creamy entry, this bold white offers a warmth of toasted oak, lightening on the midpalate to reveal crisp elements of green apple, stone fruit and lime. A lift of acidity emphasizes the high tones and floral aromatics, finishing balanced and textured.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Cuvaison 2018 Coeurtina Chardonnay (Los Carneros)

Appellation: Los Carneros, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Description: Sleek and stony, with a lovely texture of lemon peel and peach fuzz, this white is light bodied and balanced, with moderate use of oak. The acidity is lively and helps the wine to retain an enduring freshness that is huge in appeal.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Artesa 2018 Chardonnay (Los Carneros)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Floral and earthy on the nose in apple blossom and sea spray, this coastal wine begins light in crisp green apple and Meyer lemon as it develops a hearty backbone of powerful intensity and lush texture. Full bodied, it retains an expansive mouthfeel and oak-influenced finish.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Crescere 2017 Platt Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Lots of lemongrass and lime-blossom aromas make for a very fresh and zesty nose on this bottling, which also shows grapefruit-peel and oyster-shell elements. The palate is very tightly woven, with lemon-flesh and pomelo-peel flavors proving very sharp and laser-focused. Drink now through 2034.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Tolosa 2019 No Oak Heritage Chardonnay (Central Coast)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: Richly brooding in soft, supple and lush texture and rich fruit, this offers bold flavors of apple, pear and Meyer lemon. From the heart of the appellation, it shows silky undertones of lemongrass and nutmeg, finding a core of spice and complexity buoyed by fresh acidity.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Duckhorn 2018 Huichica Hills Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Walker Bay, South Africa
Description: White flower and a touch of fynbos dance atop the bouquet of this vibrant white, with a core of pink apple, white melon rind and orange peel. The palate is medium in weight, with crisp fruit tones and bright acidity that yield a crisp, refreshing package. Notes of sweet spice unfold on the back of the finish, which offers medium length and complexity. Drink now.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Name: Creation 2019 Chardonnay (Walker Bay)

Appellation: Hemel-en-Aarde Ridge, South Africa
Description: This starts off surprisingly light in intensity on the nose, with faint hints of freshly dried straw, fresh apple slices and a touch of orange rind. The palate starts off with more of the same and is light upon entry, but then unveils a rounder midpalate and a creamy mouthfeel around flavors of creamed pear and baked apple that carry through to the close.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Name: Cap Maritime 2018 Chardonnay (Hemel-en-Aarde Ridge)

Appellation: Hemel-en-Aarde Ridge, South Africa
Description: This starts off surprisingly light in intensity on the nose, with faint hints of freshly dried straw, fresh apple slices and a touch of orange rind. The palate starts off with more of the same and is light upon entry, but then unveils a rounder midpalate and a creamy mouthfeel around flavors of creamed pear and baked apple that carry through to the close.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Name: Cap Maritime 2018 Chardonnay (Hemel-en-Aarde Ridge)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Toasty aromas of hazelnut and macadamia nut meet with sightly scorched lemon-butter scents on the nose of this bottling. Slightly tangy lime, lemon and grapefruit flavors show on the sip, with is very pithy in texture.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Spear 2018 Gnesa Vineyard Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Carneros, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Description: Steely and floral, with an underlying minerality of wet stone, this cool-climate white is restrained in nature. The fruit is a mix of green apple, pear and mango, with a finish of subtle baking spice.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Ziata 2018 Chardonnay (Carneros)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: Although full in body, this richly textured wine keeps its flavors and mouthfeel in good balance. Tangy acidity and ripe pear and apple flavors join light butter and baking-spice notes that demand further sipping.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Shannon Ridge 2019 High Elevation Collection Chardonnay (Lake County)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: An unusually deep gold color and almost pungent aromas of browned butter and toasted hazelnuts lead to a rich, nutty, salty sensation on the palate and indulgent butterscotch flavors. It's an extreme, uninhibited wine that is ultraflavorful.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Theopolis 2017 Theo-patra's Cuvée Blanc Chardonnay (California)

Appellation: Santa Maria Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Creamy aromas of butter and salted almonds show on the nose of this appellation blend. There is a decent grip on the sip, which frames the very strong lactic notes of butterscotch, caramel and browned butter, with baked apple providing the fruit note.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Brophy Clark 2017 Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

Appellation: Santa Maria Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Creamy aromas of butter and salted almonds show on the nose of this appellation blend. There is a decent grip on the sip, which frames the very strong lactic notes of butterscotch, caramel and browned butter, with baked apple providing the fruit note.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Brophy Clark 2017 Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Ripe honeydew, guava and light coconut-flake aromas make for a very broad and open nose for this stainless bottling from own-rooted vines. The palate is more tense in structure, with citrus-juice flavors cutting into the tropical guava notes.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Spear 2019 Gnesa Stainless Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Grapefruit peel, chiseled stone, light jasmine and hints of guava show on the nose of this bottling. Linear flavors of lime peel and lemon pith are framed by a white-stone minerality on the palate.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Cinnabar 2019 Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Restrained on the nose, this bottling offers citrus peel and pith, with tight alkaline and dried earth aromas. There is a clean, chalky grip to the sip, where the baking-soda-like minerality frames white fleshed fruit and more citrus-pith flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Myka 2019 Chardonnay (Central Coast)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: With its pale golden hue, this wine has aromas of yellow apple, pineapple and Bosc pear. The palate is direct and lightly creamy, with a pleasing acidic lift. The balance is impressive throughout.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Alki 2019 Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: Fermented primarily in stainless steel, this is a broadly appealing white wine that is lengthy in baking-spice and fruity overtones of caramel apple and fig. Fleshy and moderately rich, it offers a supple texture that endures and will please a wide range of palates.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Hess Collection 2018 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This site has proved itself again and again to be a special spot for this variety as it does here. Aromas of toast, crayon and clarified butter lead creamy, well-balanced fruit flavors. It's an enjoyable example of a creamy style.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Basel Cellars 2019 Sur Lie Olsen Vineyard Chardonnay (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: Made in a sizably opulent and robust style, this concentrated wine is richly layered in baked pear, vanilla and toasted oak. Textured and weighty, it delivers memorable intensity and lasting flavor.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Beringer 2018 Private Reserve Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Petaluma Gap, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This wine opens in a touch of matchstick before finding its groove on the midpalate. It is bright and crisp in acidity and with sharp flavors of green apple and quince.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Thirty-Seven 2018 Chardonnay (Petaluma Gap)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of peach, straw and sweet spice lead to stone fruit flavors that are rich in the center. Like many wines from this vintage, its appeal is much about the balance it brings.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2018 Canoe Ridge Estate Chardonnay (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Edna Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Clean lines of white melon, white peach, pineapple, sea salt and toast burst from the nose of this bottling. It's broad and ripe on the palate with strong stone-fruit flavors, as an underlying acidity and subtle tension holds those richer aspects intact.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Hitch 2019 Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Candied lemon and honeysuckle aromas pick up a slight dairy edge on the nose of this bottling. There's an earthy streak to the palate, where dried citrus and apple flavors rise in the midpalate.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Landmark 2018 Hilliard Bruce Vineyard Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Candied lemon and honeysuckle aromas pick up a slight dairy edge on the nose of this bottling. There's an earthy streak to the palate, where dried citrus and apple flavors rise in the midpalate.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Landmark 2018 Hilliard Bruce Vineyard Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Mendocino, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Ripe fruit flavors and generous oak accents come together well in this smooth, full-bodied wine. Plenty of pear and golden-apple flavors ride light acidity along with baking spices and a touch of butter.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Moniker 2019 La Ribera Vineyard Chardonnay (Mendocino)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Toasted almonds, brown-butter and apple-tonic aromas make for a rich and generous nose on this reserve bottling. The palate is also rich, with baked pear and apple as well as buttered toast flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Two Sisters 2018 Courtney's Vineyard Reserve Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This tasty, full-flavored wine marries nicely ripe pears, apples and lemons with attractive baking spices and perhaps a touch of sweetness on a supple but refreshing texture. It will be a crowd-pleaser.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Wente 2019 Morning Fog Estate Grown Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Chalk Hill, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This full-bodied, hearty white tastes of buttery brioche, baked pear and Meyer lemon, with a concentration of pineapple that adds to the richness. Toasted oak is prominent throughout.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Chalk Hill 2018 Felta Chardonnay (Chalk Hill)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Clarified butter aromas are predominant, followed by notes of straw and peach. Full-bodied, creamy flavors follow. For those looking for a rich, buttery style, look no further.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2018 Indian Wells Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Monterey County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Poached pear, lime-sauce, honeysuckle and honey drizzled toast aromas show on the nose of this bottling. It's very full on the palate, with baked apple, almond-cream and cinnamon flavors, leading into a brisk lemon kick on the finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Hess Select 2018 Chardonnay (Monterey County)

Appellation: Arroyo Seco, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Asian pear, honeysuckle, wet chalk and light toast aromas make for a pleasing entry to the nose of this wine. The palate starts in a tightly woven fashion with cement, chalk and light coconut-cream flavors, and then a wave of tropical plumeria and jasmine swoops in.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: 7 Cellars 2019 The Farm Collection Chardonnay (Arroyo Seco)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: Opening in a whiff of matchstick, this sleek white exudes green apple, pear and a hint of fig. It is made in a hearty style and finished in toasted oak. Baking spice and vanilla play in the background.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Beringer 2018 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Lamorinda, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Butter and butterscotch flavors dominate this rich, ripe and mouthcoating wine. It is full bodied, feels soft in terms of acidity and has a candy-apple finish.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Meadow View 2019 Mary Leigh's Vineyard Jon's Vineyard Chardonnay (Lamorinda)

Appellation: Monterey County, Central Coast, California, US
