Description: Creamy aromas of Meyer lemon poached in butter and cashew show on the nose of this bottling. There's a light lime-tonic aspect to the sip as well as an almond-cream richness, leading into a dried lemon-rind finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: William Wright 2019 Chardonnay (Monterey County)

Appellation: Carneros, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is a fleshy, oak-laden white, with a touch of baking spice and butter that's intensely layered and broadly rich across the palate. Baked apple, pineapple and vanilla land on the finish with full-bodied fleshiness and lush texture.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Rombauer 2019 Home Ranch Chardonnay (Carneros)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas offer notes of clarified butter, peach and Muscat gummy. The flavors are lighter styled, straight down the fairway.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2019 Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Brightly floral and made in an approachable style, this easygoing white shows fresh layers of green apple, pear and moderate oak. It retains a liveliness throughout, finishing in a subtle seasoning of nutmeg.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Bewitched 2019 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Monterey County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Toasted nuts, ripe lemon and light butterscotch aromas pull the nose into this bottling. There is a brief textural edge to the palate before it flattens into unctuous marzipan and butterscotch flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Ragtag 2017 Chardonnay (Monterey County)

Appellation: Carneros, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Description: Sleek in racy acidity and a stony texture, this moderately ripe white is enduringly earthy and floral, with lasting notes of Meyer lemon, green apple and fig.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Louis Pommery 2019 Chardonnay (Carneros)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Lightly honeyed aromas of pineapple and ripe orange are clean on the nose of this bottling. There's just enough grip to the palate, giving depth to the yellow-pear and tangerine-peel flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Allan Hancock 2019 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Light aromas of apple blossom, honeysuckle and wet stone make for a pleasant nose in this widely available bottling. There's decent tension to the sip, where a chalky mouthfeel carries lime tonic and citrus-blossom flavors, as well as riper hints of plumeria and coconut.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Castle Rock 2019 Chardonnay (Central Coast)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of star fruit, pineapple and yellow apple lead to straightforward fruit flavors. It's a pleasing expression of the variety without any apparent oak influence.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Simply... 2018 Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: Subtle aromas of dried pear, light mango flesh and honey show on the nose of this pleasant bottling, which is primarily sourced from the Central Coast in this inaugural vintage. The palate is loaded with baked apple and lemon-zest flavors, proving smooth rather than tense in texture.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Uncorked by Cosmopolitan 2019 Chardonnay (California)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Fruit for this wine comes from the new Royal Slope appellation. Aromas of petroleum jelly and toasted Grape-Nuts lead to a light, flavorful palate. Pair it with grilled shrimp basted with butter, garlic and lime juice.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Baer 2019 Shard Stillwater Creek Vineyard Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: Clean while ripe aromas of peach, lime and bubblegum show on the nose of this bottling. There's a bit of zest to the palate, where rich flavors of pineapple and guava prove quite lush.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Agua Dulce 2019 Reserve Chardonnay (California)

Appellation: Green Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Dry and medium bodied, with a sense of fullness from the oak, this moderately structured white offers steely layers of green apple and fig.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Trollop 2019 Chardonnay (Green Valley)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Honeyed aromas of dried lemon peel, apricot brioche and candied macadamia nuts make for a very rich style of Chardonnay. That nutty richness also shows on the sip, full of marzipan, dried citrus and baked apple.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: YNOT 2018 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Honeyed aromas of dried lemon peel, apricot brioche and candied macadamia nuts make for a very rich style of Chardonnay. That nutty richness also shows on the sip, full of marzipan, dried citrus and baked apple.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: YNOT 2018 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Arroyo Seco, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dried orange-peel and orange-blossom aromas meet with rich hazelnut on the nose of this bottling. Dried lemon and dried apple flavors show on the palate.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Hahn 2019 Chardonnay (Arroyo Seco)

Appellation: Arroyo Seco, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Toasty oak aromas lead into hazelnut, pecan and marzipan expressions on the nose of this bottling. The palate is loaded with roasted nuts and oak, showing flavors of butterscotch, seared marshmallow and ripe apple baked in brown spices.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Wente 2019 Riva Ranch Vineyard Chardonnay (Arroyo Seco)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Rounded and crisp aromas of Pink Lady apple, light honey and a hint of French toast show on the nose of this bottling. Dried lemon-peel flavors meet with lime rinds and dried earth tones on the palate.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Castoro Cellars 2019 Chardonnay (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Opening in aromas of cinnamon-seasoned apple pie, this wine is woody and floral, with strong elements of its Musque clone. Gravenstein apple and oak add a thick intensity of flavor.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Notre Vue 2019 Musque Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Juicy and rich in style, this wine shows a wealth of tropical fruit and pear, with underlying notes of oak and nutmeg. It presents as quite ripe and rich.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Fritz Underground 2017 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Margaret River, Western Australia, Australia
Description: This is a straightforward Chardonnay that doesn't offend but which shows little of Margaret River's prowess with this variety. The nose is reductive at first, with flinty, seashell aromas but also plenty of citrus and stone fruit. Things get more disjointed on the palate, where the angular acidity combined with the lemony fruit makes it feel astringent, with an odd, heavy ripeness too that sits in the opposite corner. Drink now.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Franklin Tate 2019 Chardonnay (Margaret River)

Appellation: Yarra Valley, Victoria, Australia
Description: Housed in a heavy bottle and showing quite a lot of high-end oak, this Yarra Valley Chard never quite harmonizes. The candied fruit wrestles with the vanillin barrel aromas and some sweaty reductive notes. In the mouth, the fruit, oak and acidity never quite jell, leaving a woody aftertaste amid a creamy texture.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Levantine Hill 2017 Chardonnay (Yarra Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Very strong aromas of marzipan, dried apricot and apple juice make for a very rich and nutty expression on the nose of this bottling. That almond-driven density meets with the tang of orange peels on the palate.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Asuncion Ridge 2019 Chardonnay (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is a simple, light-bodied white wine offering fleshy flavors of peach and pear with a soft midpalate of quiet oak. The finish is a little metallic, with a touch of flint.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Smoke Tree 2018 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is a tremendously bright expression from a famous site. It is exuberant in tangy lemon, crushed rock and sea spray, with lasting acidity that tapers it all. Offering a beautiful mix of texture and nuanced earthiness, this is a wholly memorable wine.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Three Sticks 2018 Durell Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Carneros, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Description: This lovely white is light on its feet, despite its inherent power and concentration. Tangerine, grapefruit and peach flavors come to the fore with ease, integrated within a cradling of toasted oak and intriguing notes of nutmeg, clove and earth.                      Virginie Boone
Designation: Year of the Dog Single Vineyard
Name: Donum 2018 Year of the Dog Single Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Quenchingly complex in crisp lemon, lime and grapefruit, this is a sublime, supple and seductive vineyard-designate, well balanced and compelling through to the end. Textured and well integrated in oak and ripeness, it unfurls additional components of green apple, stone and nutmeg slowly and with purpose.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Three Sticks 2018 Alana Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Trento, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: Creamy and boasting complexity, this iconic sparkler offers delicate aromas of white spring flower, white stone fruit and toasted bread crust. On the elegantly sparkling palate, a silky perlage accompanies mature yellow apple, white peach, honey and a hint of lemon drop alongside crisp acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Ferrari 2009 Riserva del Fondatore Extra Brut Chardonnay (Trento)

Appellation: Yamhill-Carlton, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This astonishing wine does for Oregon Chardonnay what Cayuse has done for Oregon Syrah—utterly reinvented it. Thick with flavors of mashed pears, peaches and sweet lemons, it's big but still nuanced. Scents and streaks of flower pollen, lemon meringue, baking spices and more make this compelling wine both fascinating and challenging. Winemaker Brianne Day ferments with native yeast in one-third new puncheon and two-thirds neutral barrels. This is simply stunning.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Day 2018 Belle Pente Vineyard Chardonnay (Yamhill-Carlton)

Appellation: Pfalz, Germany
Description: Smoky tones of struck flint and toast linger from nose to finish in this gorgeously steely Chardonnay. Moderately full-bodied yet piercing and focused, it's marked by zesty flavors of green apple and lemon etched by streaks of lime and chalk. Tasted in late 2020, it's a bit nervous in youth but should be at peak from 2023–2030 and hold longer still.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Friedrich Becker 2016 Mineral Chardonnay (Pfalz)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A hearty mouthfeel belies this wine's quintessential and quenching acidity, driven by its cool-climate provenance and winemaking style. Green-apple, pear and tangerine flavors meld together easily along a midpalate of complex structure and length, with a lift of crispness reappearing on the finish.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Red Car 2018 Zephyr Farms Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Eola-Amity Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Laying claim to top-tier Oregon Chardonnay status, this luscious vineyard selection marries buttered apple, ripe papaya and mango fruit to pinpoint accents of barrel toast. It's hedonistic in the best sense, balanced and bold, big but precise and thoroughly delicious.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Abbott Claim 2017 X Omni Vineyard Chardonnay (Eola-Amity Hills)

Appellation: Trento, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: Delicate aromas suggesting yellow spring flower, brioche and white stone fruit form the nose on this elegant, focused sparkler. It's racy and dry, featuring yellow apple, Bartlett pear, Meyer lemon and toast alongside a persistent, refined perlage. Crisp acidity gives it a pristine close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Ferrari NV Perlé Zero13 Chardonnay (Trento)

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This new project is the work of Chris Mazepink, formerly with Archery Summit. A field blend of cofermented clones using native yeasts, whole clusters and a mix of vessels, it's cutting edge in every way. Rich and penetrating fruit flavors of apple, melon and peach are perfectly supported by citrusy acidity. It's balanced and dense, with plenty of aging potential. Drink through 2030.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: White Walnut 2018 Worden Hill Rd. Chardonnay (Dundee Hills)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Caramel and honey greet one on the entry in a subdued richness, giving way to laser-focused, vibrant acidity and fresh fruity notes of pear and pineapple. Floral and balanced, it is seamless in structure and well integrated, with quiet oak and tannin.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Anaba 2018 Dutton Ranch Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Coombsville, Napa, California, US
Description: This wine opens in insanely floral musque-driven honeysuckle, the palate following through in lively, fresh waves of green apple and wet stone. Barrel fermented, the oak is quiet and well integrated, providing structure and substance.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Ancien 2018 Musque Chardonnay (Coombsville)

Appellation: Green Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From a clone once called the Chardonnay Musque selection, this wine is highly aromatic and fresh. Juicy tropical fruit and tangerine flavors remain crisp and brilliant, leading to a complex midpalate of Meyer lemon and pear. The finish is topped by lasting, lingering layers of hazelnut.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Dutton-Goldfield 2018 Rued Vineyard Chardonnay (Green Valley)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Ripe aromas of melon, salted white peach and light caramel are offset by tense lime-pith scents on the nose of this bottling. It's tense and deeply layered in mineral tones on the palate, where oyster-shell and chalk flavors meet with lemon-pith and toast tones.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Sanford 2018 Sanford & Benedict Vineyard Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Ripe aromas of melon, salted white peach and light caramel are offset by tense lime-pith scents on the nose of this bottling. It's tense and deeply layered in mineral tones on the palate, where oyster-shell and chalk flavors meet with lemon-pith and toast tones.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Sanford 2018 Sanford & Benedict Vineyard Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Deliciously crisp in tangerine, this lovely white features a pear-like creaminess on the midpalate, a complex complement that tangles through structured, nuanced elegance. This boasts fruit from several vineyard designates, including grapes from Zephyr (80% of the mix), Red Car estate (13%) and Mohrhardt (7%).                      Virginie Boone
Name: Red Car 2018 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Fort Ross-Seaview, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Fresh and stony in texture, this lovely, light-bodied white expresses anise and oyster shell, with a touch of brine. Textured and complex, it delivers plenty of nuanced apple, pear and Meyer lemon, within a foundation of structure and grace.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Red Car 2018 Estate Vineyard Chardonnay (Fort Ross-Seaview)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Winemaker Marie-Eve Gilla has consistently made some of Washington's most delicious Chardonnay, and here at her new assignment working with some of the state's best fruit, she takes it to another level. It's all about subtlety, with aromas of apple, pear, spice and whiffs of pineapple. The palate is textured and flavorful, but it's the balance that captivates. Structure, balance, texture, acidity: This wine has it all—a true accomplishment for this winemaker and for the state.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Valdemar 2018 DuBrul Vineyard Chardonnay (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Bright and enduringly elegant, this white sources grapes from several Dutton-farmed sites in addition to the Scribe property in Sonoma. Citrus and pear flavors are wrapped in baking spice and brioche, never losing sight of its lively, fresh foundation of acidity.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Anaba 2018 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Winemaker and owner Chris Mazepink has a deft touch with the grape, weaving a complex mix of tree fruits, citrus peel and light touches of cracker and cookie dough. Flavors are deep and well-delineated, finishing with suggestions of lemon drop candy, honeydew and bee pollen.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: White Walnut 2018 Chardonnay (Dundee Hills)

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Winemaker and owner Chris Mazepink has a deft touch with the grape, weaving a complex mix of tree fruits, citrus peel and light touches of cracker and cookie dough. Flavors are deep and well-delineated, finishing with suggestions of lemon drop candy, honeydew and bee pollen.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: White Walnut 2018 Chardonnay (Dundee Hills)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Complex, layered and rich in style, this white offers texture and fresh underlying acidity. Tastes of white peach, Gravenstein apple and pear mingle effortlessly across a lengthy palate that's nuanced in oak and baking spice.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Landmark 2018 Damaris Reserve Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A blend sourced from four vineyards, including old vines from Farina Vineyard on Sonoma Mountain, this impressive white is complex and structured. A floral opening of jasmine and ginger leads to a lengthy fruit component of red apple and peach, the oak neutral and the finish fresh in acidity.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Donelan 2017 Nancie Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Mature and inviting honey, butterscotch, pear tart and toasted nut flavors help give this full-bodied wine a warm, broad expression on the palate and a lingering finish. It is concentrated, layered and mellow, showing what an extra year or two in the winery cellar can do.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Ruby Hill Winery 2017 Reserve Collection Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Not many pedigreed, iconic, pioneering American wineries put out estate-grown wines at this price. Wiht 60% of the grapes coming from the original 53-year-old vines, this delicious wine is scented with Bourbon barrel, flavored with ripe mixed apples, and finished with spicy pie crust. Yet it remains elegant, supple and precise; it's in no way over the top.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: The Eyrie Vineyards 2018 Chardonnay (Dundee Hills)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Soft, creamy aromas of nectarine and apricot meet with warmer touches of butterscotch and crème fraîche on the light yet lush nose of this bottling. There's a chalky, grippy texture to the sip, where a toasty backdrop upholds flavors of baked lemon, macadamia nut and sea salt.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Thomas Fogarty 2017 Damiana Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Linear and racy in acidity, this is a steely, elegant white with a rounded midpalate and accents of honeysuckle and lemongrass. Meyer lemon, lime and blood orange combine with balanced oak and tannin, finishing in a touch of baking spice.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Anaba 2018 WestLands Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Moon Mountain District Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Barrel fermented, this white is rich and oak-influenced, with a memorable taste of pineapple upside-down cake. Sparkling acidity and a floral edge of honeysuckle balances and contrasts against the richer tones and complex body.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Chiron Wines 2018 Nectar Dance Chuy's Vineyard Chardonnay (Moon Mountain District Sonoma County)

Appellation: Chehalem Mountains, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This has plenty of bottle age, so drink up. From the estate's top vineyard, it's rich and creamy, with buttery apple pie flavors in abundance. It was fermented and aged in a mix of oak barrels and concrete egg. Just 14% of the barrels were new.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Rex Hill 2016 Jacob-Hart Vineyard Chardonnay (Chehalem Mountains)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Lemony crisp in lime and grapefruit, this vineyard-designate made by Greg La Follette is acid-driven and textured—a lovely, balanced combination of cool-climate style and substance. From a site in the Sebastopol Hills, it shows the spice and earthiness of that fog-enshrouded region.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Alquimista Cellars 2017 Mes Filles Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Rich and creamy, with a leesy, textured mouthfeel, this offers perfectly ripened tree fruits along with light streaks of caramel and buttered nuts. It's a wine of impeccable balance, with what seems to be more new oak exposure than the regular bottling, but not at all too much. The youthful energy of this young wine argues for drinking it sooner rather than later, though it should be fine over the next half decade.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Bluebird Hill 2018 Reserve Chardonnay (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Nutty and rich in baked apple, this is a luscious and layered wine highlighted by lovely secondary aspects of pineapple and pear. Lengthy and complex, it wraps in its oak components seamlessly.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Journeyman 2018 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Layers of ashy minerality meet with hints of lemon peel, melon and warm cake on the pure and focused nose of this bottling. The palate is also laser-tight, showing lemon and grapefruit peel, chalk, brisk green-apple and slightly saline flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Paradise Springs 2018 Sanford & Benedict Vineyard Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Clean lines of grapefruit peel, crushed sea shell and an alkaline citrus pith show on the nose of this estate bottling. The lime-peel and pith focus of the palate leads into a toastier finish, yet it's the firm and fresh acidity that keeps the attention.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Spear 2018 Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Clean while creamy aromas of Meyer lemon zest, honeysuckle and butter show on the nose of this single-vineyard expression. The tense palate delivers a strong mineral kick from chalk and chiseled stone, offering tight yuzu and lime-peel flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Sanford 2018 La Rinconada Vineyard Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Petaluma Gap, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Made in a creamy, opulent style, this wine brims in baked apple, brioche and toasted oak. With a balanced, medium-body and a lush texture, it finishes with a beautiful bite of lemon cookie.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Sangiacomo 2018 Roberts Road Vineyard Chardonnay (Petaluma Gap)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This new Oregon project from Beck Family Estates debuts with a fresh, minerally blend of grapes from Seven Springs, X Omni and Chehalem Mountain vineyards. Indigenous yeast fermentations were done in one-third new oak, then aged in stainless steel prior to bottling. Green melon, green apple, apple skin and cucumber flavors combine in a wine with excellent balance and penetration.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Abbott Claim 2018 Chardonnay (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Clean lines of lime balm, crushed limestone and crystallized pear are lightly brushed with butter on the engaging nose of this bottling. The palate is also a showcase of purity, delivering kiwi, lemon peel and lychee before leading into delicate flavors of buttercream and macadamia nut on the finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: D'Alfonso-Curran 2018 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: Concentrated and creamy but not overly showy, this wine is balanced, restrained and layered. It meshes an apple-tart flavor with subtle vanilla and nutmeg nuances while underlying acidity achieves excellent balance.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Kendall-Jackson 2019 Vintner's Reserve Chardonnay (California)

Appellation: Carneros, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Description: Steely and made in an elegant, refined style, this vineyard-designate impresses in its grasp of stone and floral qualities: floral on the nose and linear in vibrant acidity. Green apple, pear and Meyer lemon compound a sophisticated, textured varietal expression.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Ram's Gate 2018 Hyde Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)

Appellation: Santa Clara Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This bottling expertly captures both the warm sunshine of the southern Santa Clara Valley and the maritime influence of the nearby ocean. Aromas of peach, daffodil and buttercream are sprinkled with sea salt on the nose, while the palate packs in flavors of lemon zest, coconut flake and salted butter.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Sarah's Vineyard 2018 Estate Chardonnay (Santa Clara Valley)

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Formerly Ian's Reserve, then Stoller Reserve, what's in the bottle remains the same—fresh, clean and tasty single-vineyard juice. There's a polished mix of apple and pear fruit, annotated with touches of sliced orange and a smooth, well-integrated finish with a lingering suggestion of butter cookie. It was barrel fermented and aged in 20% new oak.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Chehalem 2018 Reserve Chardonnay (Dundee Hills)

Appellation: Santa Maria Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Opulent aromas of butter and pineapple meet with brisk tones of grapefruit peel on the nose of this bottling. A compelling chalky texture frames the palate, where brisk lime, lemon balm and more underripe pineapple flavors lead into a blanched almond finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Colluvial 2017 Las Nenas Sierra Madre Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

Appellation: Mendocino Ridge, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Attractive butterscotch and vanilla aromas lead to tight fruit flavors and nutty, toasty notes in this full-bodied and well-balanced wine that is at once broad in mouthfeel and nicely braced with tangy acidity. Best from 2023.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Bee Hunter 2017 Mariah Vineyard Chardonnay (Mendocino Ridge)

Appellation: Fort Ross-Seaview, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Earthy crushed rock and gravelly texture meets a crisp frontier of tangerine, lime and green apple in this coastal-influenced white. Earthy and slightly spicy, it reveals deft elements of nutmeg and light, integrated oak.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Red Car 2018 Mohrhardt Chardonnay (Fort Ross-Seaview)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Fresh aromas of soft white peach, citrus pith and chalk meet with a toasty brioche tone on the expressive nose of this bottling. There's a firm, chalky texture to the sip, where nectarine, buttercream and fresh lemon-zest flavors surround the nutty core and lingering acidity.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Alma Rosa 2018 El Jabali Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Ribbon Ridge, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Crisp and layered, with whiffs of flower and spice, this appealing young wine offers fresh apple fruit, along with lighter, well-defined flavors of cucumber and white peach. The low alcohol is in keeping with the flavor profile, but the biodynamic farming brings great depth and detail, unusual in such a lightly ripened wine.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Brick House 2018 Cascadia Chardonnay (Ribbon Ridge)

Appellation: Petaluma Gap, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Fresh in anise, peach and stone, this wine has a nuanced texture and crisp, mineral-driven steeliness that keeps it lively and vibrant in the glass. Stainless-steel fermented and aged in neutral oak, it is a lovely take on the cool-climate appellation.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Keller 2019 Oro De Plata Chardonnay (Petaluma Gap)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: Made from estate grapes as well as fruit from other prominent sites, this wine opens in a mix of matchstick and fresh hay. Nutty brioche and stone-fruit accent a succulent and luxurious core of richness and weight, with a lasting lift of acidity.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Merryvale 2018 Silhouette Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Carneros, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Description: Both barrel and stainless-steel fermented, this is a bright, balanced white wine that shows a juicy core of pear and apple. Lively and weighty, it has substance and style within a context of vibrant acidity and earthy stone.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Starmont 2018 Chardonnay (Carneros)

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: As the label indicates, some of these vines date back half a century. The layered flavors of kiwi, apple and pear fruit are accented with scents and hints of mint and bubblegum. The long, detailed finish brings a touch of bitter lemon rind. As with so many of Eyrie's white and red wines, the aging potential on this is well beyond average. Drink now and over the next decade.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: The Eyrie Vineyards 2017 Original Vines Chardonnay (Dundee Hills)

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Rich and tangy lemon drop candy fruit sasses the palate, with more citrus, pineapple and nectarine right behind. With its mouthfilling, chunky quality, this fruit-powered, big-shouldered Chardonnay retains enough acidity to lift itself up through a racy, cleansing finish. Barrel fermented in 10% new French oak, it should be enjoyed over the next half decade.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Ayoub 2018 Chardonnay (Dundee Hills)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This bright and lively wine is classy in every way—a Chardonnay that lifts the palate, sharpens food flavors and threatens to become the life of the party. Tree fruits and barrel toast are in play, with a highlight of Meyer lemon. The juicy and fresh finish keeps the flavors front and center.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Bluebird Hill 2019 Chardonnay (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Monterey, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Rich aromas of buttercream, marshmallow and roasted apple are voluptuous on the nose of this bottling. The palate is enlivened by strong lemon-peel acidity, then leads into apricot, apple and honeysuckle flavors, proving more in balance than suggested by the rounded nose.                      Matt Kettmann
Designation: La Grande Lumière San Bernabe Vineyard Estate Grown
Name: Diora 2018 La Grande Lumière San Bernabe Vineyard Estate Grown Chardonnay (Monterey)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This crisp, dry and toasty wine boasts bold, freshly baked bread aromas and lemon and butter flavors on a lively texture of tiny bubbles and brilliant acidity. It's a fun, bracing twist on tradition.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Donkey & Goat 2019 Lily's Pet Nat Sparkling Chardonnay (Anderson Valley)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This big, bold wine was made in a classic California reserve style, offering heady aromas of toasted oak and roasted walnuts, rich and deep Bosc pear flavors and a deliciously thick texture that helps carry it all through a lingering finish.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Rubino Estates Winery 2018 Landmark Collection Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Rich in an oak-driven layering of caramel crème brûlée and butterscotch, this wine is lengthy and lush on the palate, with a hearty soul balanced by underlying acidity. It shows coastal coolness and touches of baking spice and earthiness.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Lion's Head 2018 Panthera Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Floral and mineral-driven, this white is also robust in tropical and stone fruit, while being substantial in style and body weight. A note of honey adorns the palate and nose and emphasizes the viscous roundedness in the wine.                      Virginie Boone
Name: MacRostie 2018 Kent Ritchie Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Trento, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of white spring flower, white orchard fruit and a whiff of brioche lead the way. On the crisp palate, an elegant perlage accompanies creamy yellow apple, pear and lemon drop.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Ferrari NV Brut Chardonnay (Trento)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: An estate-grown wine given 15 months in French oak, 35% of it new, this is a rich and creamy expression of the grape, opening in a hit of cinnamon stick. A luxurious midpalate is highlighted in brioche, green apple and Meyer lemon, with a balanced take on both acidity and oak.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Hess 2018 The Lioness Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Carneros, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Description: Honeysuckle and lemongrass accent a steely core of wet stone, Meyer lemon and pear in this crisp, balanced vineyard-designate. As the core of fresh citrus builds, a contrasting note of butterscotch teases and adds lasting richness.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Saintsbury 2018 Sangiacomo Green Acres Chardonnay (Carneros)

Appellation: Santa Lucia Highlands, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Pristine aromas of gardenia lead into salted orange slices, papaya, baked nectarine and yuzu spray on the nose of this bottling. There is a decent tightness to the palate, where mandarin-pith and peel flavors lead into riper peach by the finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Taraval 2019 Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Ripe lemon and yellow plum aromas are dotted with accents of sea spray, citrus cream and white blossoms in this Chardonnay, of which about a third sees time in French oak. The palate is creamy and concentrated in juicy yellow fruit, with ample lift from bright acidity and a seared lemon note that lingers on the close.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Trestle Thirty One 2017 Chardonnay (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: Nutty, floral and earthy, this white has a crisp entry of wet stone and earthy white flower. Exotic and well integrated, it shows a lovely mix of pear, mango and peach that finds vibrancy through a backbone of balanced acidity.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Grgich Hills 2017 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Creamy texture supports a core of Golden Delicious apple and crème caramel in this medium-bodied, richly layered white, given 16 months in French oak, 28% of it new. A backbone of crisp acidity keeps it fresh and vibrant from start to finish.                      Virginie Boone
Name: La Pitchoune 2016 La Révolte Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Carneros, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Description: Floral and exotic in stone fruit, with a succulent midpalate, this estate white shows a flourish of quince, peach and white fig, the acidity vibrantly wrapped around a firm, supple core of structure and elegance.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Ram's Gate 2018 Estate Chardonnay (Carneros)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Butter, caramel and butterscotch nuances swirl through this golden-colored, full-bodied and luxuriously textured wine, strongly complementing the baked apple, honey and vanilla flavors for a very rich, concentrated expression.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Ruby Hill Winery 2018 Jewel Collection Series Estate Reserve Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dried apple and lemon-peel aromas meet with savory hints of dried herb and peanut shell on the nose of this bottling. There's a savory streak to the sip as well, where oregano adds to the dried citrus and toasted nut flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Santa Barbara Winery 2018 Reserve Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Carneros, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Description: Creamy and rounded in style, with ripe, rounded edges, this white from the great site shows a wealth of floral effusiveness and ample texture. Stone fruit and green apple mingle around vibrant, lengthy acidity and nuanced oak.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Bouchaine 2018 Hyde Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Done in a fine-tuned, lightly spicy style, this offers focused fruit flavors of apple, melon and tangerine. It was organically farmed and barrel fermented, and though there's little evidence of new wood, a pleasant hint of coconut water rolls through the finish.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Cardwell Hill 2019 Estate Bottled The Bard Chardonnay (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This is the reserve label for Abbey Road Farm. It's a two-barrel selection from the same sources as the regular Chardonnay, but here one of the barrels was new, bringing strong scents of clove and cinnamon spice as the wine is poured. Pure apple fruit flavors carry out the impression of cinnamon, and the flavors hold firm though the mouthfeel seems to flatten out a bit through the back palate. Drink this over the next two or three years.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Wilkens Family 2018 Chardonnay (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Monterey, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Very clean lines of chalk, white melon and Meyer lemon peel make for a very pure entry to the nose of this bottling. It's tightly wound on the palate, moving from brisk lime to warmer lychee, toast and buttercream flavors toward the finish, yet retaining freshness throughout.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Z. Alexander Brown 2018 Uncaged Chardonnay (Monterey)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: A rich nose of sea spray, citrus cream, blanched almond, chamomile and yellow plum starts off this delightful Chardonnay. The medium-bodied palate is silken in feel yet drawn out by a taut line of acidity. Flavors of lemon peel, white blossoms and lemongrass are lifted and pure, with a delicate white tea note extending on the textured finish.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Jamesport 2018 Saddleback Chardonnay (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Bright and racy with a textured core of Meyer lemon and crushed rock, this wine impresses in its balance of richness and acidity. Secondary notes of brioche and oak come to the fore as it develops, finishing weighty and with length.                      Virginie Boone
Name: The Calling 2018 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Carneros, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Description: Made in an elegant, austere and refined style, this tastes of apple skin, pear and just a hint of peach. With well-integrated oak providing a foundation, it has a rich underbelly of baking spice.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Saintsbury 2018 Sangiacomo Vineyards Chardonnay (Carneros)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: Fermented in concrete tank and aged in neutral oak, this steely wine is delicately layered in lemon and papaya. It shows very good substance and style on the lengthy finish.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Jax 2019 Y3 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Trento, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of yellow apple, hazelnut and brioche come to the forefront. These tones follow on to the palate alongside a lemon zest flavor set against racy acidity and a lively perlage.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Ferrari 2015 Perlé Brut Chardonnay (Trento)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: With a touch of reduction and matchstick on the nose, this wine takes time to unfurl—its thick, rich opening notes finding a sense of lightness on the midpalate. Almond, apple and pineapple flavors are met by a mineral component of crushed rock and wet stone.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Grgich Hills 2017 Paris Tasting Commemorative Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Oaky, rich and layered, this likable white offers apple, peach, pear and a whirl of butterscotch, with the oak adding a toasted note. Softly textured and rounded on the palate, it brings complexity within a full-bodied style.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Landmark 2018 Overlook Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Very focused and citrus-driven scents of grapefruit and lemon peel kick off the nose of this bottling, which also shows hints of lychee, melon and a metallic minerality. It's tightly wound on the palate, where sharp lime and lemon-peel aromas lead into richer waves of macadamia nut, dried herb and light toast.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Lester 2018 Lester Family Vineyards Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine comes from the recently approved Royal Slope appellation, and the aromas show pleasing subtlety, with notes of pear, crayon and wet stone. The lightly creamy stone fruit flavors are light on their feet, bringing the bright acidity typical of the vintage. The balance impresses, and it lingers on the finish.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Saviah 2019 Stillwater Creek Vineyard Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Santa Maria Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Sharp aromas of lime peel and lychee are very tart and brisk on the nose of this bottling from the Sierra Madre Vineyard. The palate is also laser sharp and stinging with acidity, which will mellow with time and allow the grapefruit-peel and apple-flesh flavors to come forward.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Lumen 2019 Sierra Madre Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

Appellation: Monterey, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Aromas of Meyer lemon, butter, daffodil, cream and a hint of steely minerality show on the nose of this bottling. There is solid tension on the palate, where roasted lemon, peach and apple flavors meet with a hint of smoke.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Maddalena 2018 Estate Reserve Chardonnay (Monterey)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This tiny-production wine from the famous coastal site is austere and steely in style, with a wealth of great acidity. Textured and balanced, it sings in apple, pear and wet stone, it was fermented in both concrete egg and neutral French oak.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Riley's Rows 2018 Platt Vineyard Baby Platt Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: A 50-50 blend of Yamhill-Carlton and Ribbon Ridge fruit, this outperforms the listed low alcohol degree of ripeness. It's crisp and lean to be sure, with ample lime, grapefruit and green apple flavors firmly framed with phenolic highlights from whole-cluster pressing. No new oak was used.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Abbey Road Farm 2018 Chardonnay (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is a clear, focused white, balanced and complex, with a lush midpalate. Apple, pear and stone fruit combine with ease around integrated oak and a lasting thread of baking spice.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Amici 2017 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Zesty aromas of lemon and lime peels ride over delicate creamy yeast in this unoaked Chardonnay. There's a gentle creaminess to the medium-bodied palate, filled out by juicy flavors of yellow apple and pear. A mild salty accent gives some pleasing depth to an otherwise brisk expression.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Hound's Tree 2017 Highwire Chardonnay (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Petaluma Gap, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Nutty, earthy and toasty, this estate-grown white has a steely undercurrent of pulsing acidity that keeps it vibrant and fresh. Strong flavors of pear highlight a medium-bodied palate of integrated flavors and texture.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Keller 2019 La Cruz Chardonnay (Petaluma Gap)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Barrel-fermented and given 10 months in French oak, this is an impressive and value-minded white with wide appeal. Rounded and balanced, it shows structured layers of steely flint, green apple and peach.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Valravn 2019 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas offer notes of candlewax and crayon. There's plenty of deftness to the lightly creamy flavors, keeping the interest high, with lovely balance to it all.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Gård 2018 Lawrence Vineyards Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: There's a unique and intriguing show of terroir that comes through each vintage on this wine. Alkaline aromas of baking soda and lemon pith meet with light apricot and nectarine on the nose. The palate combines dried lemon and pear peels with a strong rocky character.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Cooper-Garrod 2018 Gravel Ridge Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Seamless and stone-driven, this wine is steely with a touch of pineapple and peach. Medium bodied, it delivers fruity richness that is balanced by well-integrated acidity.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Mueller 2017 LB Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: A rich opening of spicy oak and cinnamon red hots leads the way to a midpalate of rich and rounded varietal style in this well-made, value-minded wine. Delivering texture and flavor, it finishes in a viscous layering of honey and crème brûlée.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Hess Collection 2019 Allomi Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Aromas of blossomy white flowers, crushed salt and lime peel carry the driven nose. There's a gentle creaminess to the medium-bodied palate, with savory elements of blanched almond and salt leading over gently seared lemon. It ends nutty yet lifted.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Hound's Tree 2017 Chardonnay (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Arroyo Seco, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Opulent aromas of ripe pear, gardenia, apple and coconut show on the nose of this bottling. It's racy with acidity on the sip, where a tart lemon flavor leads into apple blossom, poached pear and pineapple, with a slight butter tone on the finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: J. Lohr 2019 Riverstone Chardonnay (Arroyo Seco)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Aromas of brûléed lemon, fresh citrus peels and sea spray are energetic and lifted on the nose of this barrel-aged Chardonnay. There's a silky richness to the medium-bodied palate, yet it's driven by a taut line of acidity that extends to the finish. A delicate frame of toasty spice accents the crisp fruit, making this a well-balanced offering.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: One Woman 2017 Estate Reserve Chardonnay (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Santa Lucia Highlands, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dried lemon-peel, honeysuckle and kiwi aromas show on the nose of this bottling from renowned viticulturist Steve McIntyre's estate. Brisk flavors of lemon juice and light nectarine meet with hints of underripe pineapple on the sip.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: McIntyre Vineyards 2018 McIntyre Estate Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This complex, organically grown block selection dramatically reflects the winery's dedication to native yeasts, minimal intervention and mixed fermentation vessels. It's got a wild streak a mile wide, which may delight some palates and mystify others. The tart peach and citrus flavors turn sour as they wind down, with numerous details of pollen and yeast and herbal tea.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: White Walnut 2018 North Blocks Chardonnay (Dundee Hills)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Steely and crisp in green apple and pear, this balanced white also features an intriguing note of anise. Aged 16 months in French oak, 33% of it new, it is medium bodied in texture and body weight.                      Virginie Boone
Name: La Pitchoune 2016 Pratt Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Clarksburg, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Fresh pear and apple flavors are accented by subtle bread dough and baking-spice nuances in this medium- to full-bodied wine. It shows a good balance between ripeness and mild acidity for a fresh but satisfying impression.                      Jim Gordon
Name: LangeTwins 2019 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Clarksburg)

Appellation: Santa Lucia Highlands, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dried lemon-peel, honeysuckle and kiwi aromas show on the nose of this bottling from renowned viticulturist Steve McIntyre's estate. Brisk flavors of lemon juice and light nectarine meet with hints of underripe pineapple on the sip.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: McIntyre Vineyards 2018 McIntyre Estate Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Aromas of brûléed lemon, fresh citrus peels and sea spray are energetic and lifted on the nose of this barrel-aged Chardonnay. There's a silky richness to the medium-bodied palate, yet it's driven by a taut line of acidity that extends to the finish. A delicate frame of toasty spice accents the crisp fruit, making this a well-balanced offering.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: One Woman 2017 Estate Reserve Chardonnay (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Chalk Hill, Sonoma, California, US
Description: An acid-driven beginning evolves into a bigger, richer style on the midpalate of this wine, which is richly opulent in caramel, brioche and an intensity of fig. Rounded and lengthy, it has full-figured flavor.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Chalk Hill 2018 Estate Chardonnay (Chalk Hill)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Dense, decadent and lush in style, with vigorously rich tropical fruit, this full-bodied wine is appealingly lush. Finishing touches of brioche and crème caramel underscore its bold, memorable weight and length.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Thompson 31fifty Wine 2018 Sister Sophie's Estate Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Tart lemon-peel aromas meet with light marshmallow and hazelnut on the nose of this appellation blend. Long-lingering acidity and a taut texture frame the elderflower and nut flavors of the palate.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Paradise Springs 2018 Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Very floral aromas of plumeria and jasmine meet with clean lines of apricot, pear and chalk on the nose of this bottling. The chalky minerality comes through on the palate as well, balancing the ripe tones of peach oil and tuberose, and finishing on a bit of toast.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Porter & Plot 2018 Chardonnay (Central Coast)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Dense, decadent and lush in style, with vigorously rich tropical fruit, this full-bodied wine is appealingly lush. Finishing touches of brioche and crème caramel underscore its bold, memorable weight and length.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Thompson 31fifty Wine 2018 Sister Sophie's Estate Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Cayuga Lake, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: A surprising result from such a difficult vintage, this white offers bright aromas of peach and yellow apple that are shot through with a blossomy white flower accent. A small portion of this wine saw time in barrel, yielding a gentle roundness to the medium-bodied palate. There's ample lift to the crisp orchard fruit flavors, making this a clean, affable wine that many will enjoy.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Hosmer 2018 Chardonnay (Cayuga Lake)

Appellation: Santa Maria Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Tart lemon, light mango and lime-zest aromas meet with hints of jasmine and lemongrass on the nose of this bottling. There is tense framing to the sip, where rounded apple-flesh flavors sit atop lingering acidity, with a slightly vinous tone on the finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Amor Fati 2018 Murmur Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

Appellation: Los Carneros, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Description: An oaky nose leads to a core of vanilla and tropical mango on the palate in this richly layered white wine. A steely backbone of acidity helps to keep it both balanced and fresh.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Benziger 2018 West Rows Sangiacomo Vineyard Chardonnay (Los Carneros)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A delicate expression of the cool-climate site, layered and textured in elegant layers, this white offers quiet tones of green apple, Meyer lemon and wet stone. The oak is well integrated and supportive, adding a touch of body to the graceful whole.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Bruliam 2019 Heintz Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Trento, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: Subdued aromas suggesting toasted hazelnut, bread crust and mature white stone fruit shape the nose. The dry, linear, rather lean palate picks up where the nose leaves off, offering coconut, oak, Meyer lemon and yellow-apple skin. An elegant perlage and crisp acidity accompany the linear palate.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Ferrari 2015 Lunelli Extra Brut Riserva Chardonnay (Trento)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Bright, crisp aromas of peach, apple and yellow blossoms grace the nose of this deftly balanced Chardonnay. About half sees time in French oak, which adds a slightly creamy texture and a bit of spice to the ripe orchard fruit flavors on the palate. The fruit lingers pleasantly on the close.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Dr. Konstantin Frank 2019 Chardonnay (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Hearty and oaky, this wine has a confectionery character that makes it lush and ripe in style. Honeycomb and brioche add to the substantial intensity.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Alquimista Cellars 2016 Lorenzo Vineyards Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: There's a focused streak of rocky minerality on the nose of this bottling along with lime-blossom, lemon-balm and apple-rind aromas. The palate is very citrus-driven, showing lime and grapefruit pith, and then floral waves of jasmine and plumeria take over, leading to a coconut finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Santa Barbara Winery 2019 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Tightly woven aromas of honeysuckle, gardenia, Asian pear and lychee make for a pleasant nose on this bottling. There is a tight weave to the texture of the palate, where lime pith leads into more generous flavors of plumeria and poached pear.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Vahali 2019 Jhelum Estate Chardonnay (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Mendocino, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Mild baked apple flavors and a smooth, palate-coating texture give this full-bodied wine a quiet appeal. Hints of butter, vanilla and peach develop on the palate and linger on the finish.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Nelson Family Vineyards 2019 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Mendocino)

Appellation: Monterey, Central Coast, California, US
Description: One of the more reliably overdelivering brands in California wine today, this bottling begins with aromas of freshly baked apple, sea-salt caramel, vanilla and butter. Both poached and baked apple flavors show on the sip, where a metallic minerality frames a finish of more vanilla and light buttercream.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Noble Vines 2019 446 Chardonnay (Monterey)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: There's depth and richness to this barrel-fermented and barrel-aged Chardonnay. Luscious yellow plum, lemon and melon flavors are wrapped in a toasty, warm spice embrace.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Pellegrini Vineyards 2016 Vintner's Pride Estate Grown Unfiltered Chardonnay (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Pear, apple and candlewax aromas lead to light but creamy feeling peach flavors. There's a mouthwatering aspect to it that ups the interest.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Mercer Bros. 2019 Chardonnay (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: New York, New York Other, New York, US
Description: Rich aromas of chamomile, peach and pineapple carry to the weighty, unctuous palate. For all that weight, there's a taut texture and bright acidity to lift it all up, making this a well-balanced, creamy white.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Millbrook 2018 Proprietor's Special Reserve Chardonnay (New York)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Delicate aromas of lemon peel and pineapple open up as this wine sits in the glass. There's admirable breadth and juiciness to the fruit on the palate, with a gentle creaminess undercut by lifted acidity and a dash of crushed salt. Overall, it shows nice energy and lift, ending with citrus and warm spice accents.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Living Roots 2018 Orchards of Seneca Chardonnay (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Seneca Lake, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Bright aromas of orange blossom and lily grace the nose of this Chardonnay that's blended with a tiny amount of Traminette. The palate is ripe and juicy in flavors of pineapple and peach, cinched up by a pleasing textural grip and bright acidity. This is a solid buy for those looking for a fruity yet balanced medium-bodied white.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Fox Run 2019 Doyle Family Chardonnay (Seneca Lake)

Appellation: Santa Lucia Highlands, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This bottling is starting to show its age a bit, with aromas of Meyer lemon balm leading into brioche and toasted chestnuts. The palate offers flavors of applesauce, light vanilla and dried lemon peels.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: McIntyre Vineyards 2016 Block K1 McIntyre Estate Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

Appellation: Santa Maria Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This wine is showing its age a bit, yet begins with inviting aromas of honey, seared marshmallow, buttercream and marzipan. It's less lush on the palate than expected, with flavors of salted almond, roasted apple and more marzipan.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Wild Horse 2016 Cheval Sauvage Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

Appellation: The Hamptons, Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Aromas of blanched almond, yellow plum and crushed salt are rich on the nose. The wine's creamy and rounded in feel on the palate, driven by a juicy yellow fruit that's dotted with savory, salty elements. For all its plushness, it has bright acidity in equal measure.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Wölffer 2018 Perle Chardonnay (The Hamptons, Long Island)

Appellation: Chehalem Mountains, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This verges on sourness, with green apple fruit flavors and a touch of gooseberry. Fermented and aged 16 months in neutral barrels, it nonetheless shows a hint of toast in the finish. Definitely a wine for acid lovers, best served as an accompaniment to something along the lines of garlic-roasted chicken.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Trathen Hall 2018 Arlyn Vineyard Chardonnay (Chehalem Mountains)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Billowing aromas of pineapple, melon and peach carry the nose of this Chardonnay. It's rich and fruity on the palate, with a gentle creaminess that is immediately pushed aside by racing acidity.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Lenz 2015 Old Vines Chardonnay (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Quiet aromas of banana and melon meld with a gentle butter cookie accent on the nose. There's ample juiciness to the light-bodied palate, with tart lemon and apple flavors framed by quiet, savory accents.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Jamesport 2019 76 Chardonnay (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Aromas of lemon and pear meld with a slightly brûléed lemon tone, which adds richness and depth to the nose. There's a subtle creaminess to the delicate palate, with pear, apple and citrus flavors pushed along by balanced acidity.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Lamoreaux Landing 2018 Reserve Estate Bottled Chardonnay (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: A slightly brûléed lemon note melds with fresh melon and sea spray in this Chardonnay. There's pleasing creaminess to the palate, with lifted acidity pushing it along.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Lamoreaux Landing 2019 Reserve Estate Bottled Chardonnay (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: A mild nose of butterscotch, lemon and crushed salt carries the nose of this Chardonnay. Seeing time in both stainless steel and oak, the wine has a creaminess on the palate as well as some toasty spice. The citrus fruit takes on a brûléed character, ending taut and lifted.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Bright Leaf 2018 Reserve Chardonnay (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: With tiny amounts of Marsanne and Viognier, this lively white is reductive at first and showy in oak. It evolves to deliver a rich, rounded expression of vanilla, peach and pear, finishing in baking spice.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Carol Shelton 2018 Wild Thing Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Oregon, Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: Solid winemaking elevates this affordable wine, sourced from vineyards north, south and in-between. The fruit mix is pleasant but generic, mostly apple flavors. There are interesting hints of buttered herbs and chicken stock, light enough to be considered unusual accents. The wine was not put through malolactic fermentation.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: A to Z 2019 Chardonnay (Oregon)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Semitropical in style and floral on the nose, this is a likable white that's smooth and simple, with understated richness and length.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Michael Pozzan 2018 Giapoza Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Panna cotta and vanilla make up the aromas and the flavors. A creamy feel caps it off, along with a light medicinal accent. It finishes warm.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Headturner 2018 Flyaway Chardonnay (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Monterey County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Crisp Asian and green-pear aromas meet with jasmine on the very floral nose of this bottling. A tightly wound citrus flavor on the palate unfurls into richer poached pear and sea-salt flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Highlands 41 2019 Chardonnay (Monterey County)

Appellation: Monterey County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Toasty aromas of macadamia nut, coconut and light marshmallow show on the nose of this bottling. With light tannins that float across the fluffy, pleasant palate, the wine offers seared apple and more marshmallow flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Kendall-Jackson 2019 Winemaker's Block Chardonnay (Monterey County)

Appellation: Oregon, Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: Solid winemaking elevates this affordable wine, sourced from vineyards north, south and in-between. The fruit mix is pleasant but generic, mostly apple flavors. There are interesting hints of buttered herbs and chicken stock, light enough to be considered unusual accents. The wine was not put through malolactic fermentation.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: A to Z 2019 Chardonnay (Oregon)

Appellation: Oregon, Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: Quite accessible and enjoyable already, this mixes pear and apple flavors into a smooth, fruit-driven wine with just the right dollop of buttery barrel toast. It's balanced and medium-bodied, nicely pulled together and a fine value.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Acrobat 2019 Chardonnay (Oregon)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Mildly coiled aromas of lemon-lime and pear carry the nose. This is light in feel, with streamlined citrus and apple flavors filled out by a gently creamy yeast note. It ends lifted and bright on a burst of citrus.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Anthony Road 2018 Unoaked Chardonnay (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: Pippin apples and Anjou pears come to mind as this generous and fruity wine spreads lavish flavors across the palate. Dashes of vanilla and honey add some extra interest but the pure fruitiness defines it.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Grayson 2019 Lot 11 Chardonnay (California)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Rounded and rich in caramelized apple and undeniable earthiness, this is a full-bodied, robustly made white wine from the site. The oak is pronounced and contributes additional heartiness and length.                      Virginie Boone
Name: MacRostie 2018 Wildcat Mountain Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Suisun Valley, North Coast, California, US
Description: Almost-sweet pear and apple flavors are ripe and mouthfilling in this fruity and moderately spicy wine. Hints of vanilla and toast complement the juicy pear notes and are balanced by light acidity.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Vezer Family Vineyard 2018 Arlene Chardonnay (Suisun Valley)

Appellation: Tupungato, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Generic white fruit aromas of apple and pear are standard but clean. On the palate, this high-alcohol Chardonnay (15% abv) is round and creamy. Oaky melon and apple flavors are a touch flabby through the finish.                      Michael Schachner
Designation: Cameleon Signature Made with Organic Grapes
Name: Domaine Bousquet 2019 Cameleon Signature Made with Organic Grapes Chardonnay (Tupungato)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: A tiny portion (2%) of this wine was aged in French oak and 20% went through malolactic fermentation, yielding a white that blends both creamy and fresh elements. Butterscotch, lemon peel and pear are carried along by bright acidity and supported on a gently creamy frame.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: RGNY 2018 Scielo NY Chardonnay (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: This rich and buttery wine offers an aroma of buttered popcorn, flavors of cream and butterscotch and an almost sweet texture that's soft in acidity.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Sand Point 2019 Chardonnay (California)

Appellation: Mendocino, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Like a liquid apple pie, this wine revels in cinnamon, butter and baked apple flavors carried on a rich texture. It's mouthfilling, soft in balance and seems sweet on the finish.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Sketchbook 2019 Chardonnay (Mendocino)

Appellation: Mendocino, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This fruity and mildly buttery wine is medium bodied, feels pretty rich and ripe and offers red- and green-apple flavors accented by light vanilla notes.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Parducci 2019 Small Lot Chardonnay Chardonnay (Mendocino)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Perfumed aromas of jasmine and peach carry the nose. The delicate palate shows more of the same, with a slightly soapy floral tone arising on the midpalate. Lemony acidity arises toward the finish to cinch things up.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Pindar Vineyards 2019 Sunflower Special Reserve Chardonnay (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Quiet aromas of butterscotch and pear carry the nose. It's rather light in feel, with lifted lemon and apple flavors wrapped in a slightly toasty sheen. It's balanced well by bright acidity, ending savory and creamy.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Wagner 2018 Reserve Estate Bottled Chardonnay (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Coconut and lemon curd aromas are at the fore in this oaked Chardonnay, which has a juicy pineapple note at the core. It's creamy in feel yet lifted by bright acidity, with a sheen of oaky spice riding over the lusciously fruity core.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Buttonwood Grove 2017 Chardonnay (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Barrel fermented and aged, this white is meaty and full bodied, with a robust intensity on the palate. Peach, pineapple and fennel highlights lead to an oaky finish.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Monte Smith 2017 Dutton Ranch Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Charred citrus and toasted hazelnut carry the nose. The medium-bodied palate is linear and focused, with brisk lemon and seared yellow plum flavors ending with a flurry of toasty spice.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Pellegrini Vineyards 2017 Estate Grown Chardonnay (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Aromas of banana, guava and pear carry the fruit-laden nose. It's light in feel on the palate, with flavors of mixed tropical fruit lifted by bright enough acidity. It's enjoyable for its straightforward, easy nature.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Wagner 2019 Unoaked Estate Bottled Chardonnay (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Monterey County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Lemon and grapefruit-peel aromas meet with baked apple on the nose of this bottling. Seared apple and Meyer lemon flavors show on the simple but pleasant palate.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Estancia 2018 Chardonnay (Monterey County)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Lifted aromas of lemon peel, crushed stone and pear carry the nose. There's a gentle creamy, yeasty note on the medium-bodied palate, lifted by juicy flavors of yellow apple and lemon. A final burst of citrus-laden acidity lends brightness to the close.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Heron Hill 2018 Ingle Vineyard Unoaked Chardonnay (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: This rich yet balanced Chardonnay displays creamy melon and pear flavors balanced by lifted citrus. It's straightforward in its appeal, but is a composed, complete package that will please many.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Wölffer 2019 Chardonnay (Long Island)

Appellation: Mendoza, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Aromas of white flowers, butter, woody oak and generic white fruits set up a basic palate with just enough acidity to keep things in balance. Barely ripe apple and melon flavors are a touch stalky and salty, while this feels diluted on the finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bodega Norton 2019 Reserva Chardonnay (Mendoza)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This smooth and rich-textured wine offers a creamy mouthfeel, light apple and Bosc pear flavors and a noticeable streak of earth, almond and flint.                      Jim Gordon
Name: William Gunn 2019 Chardonnay (El Dorado)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Perfumed aromas of apple, pear and lemon drive the nose and palate, with a gentle creaminess filling it out. It's a bit low in verve on the clipped finish.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Stony Lonesome 2018 Unoaked Chardonnay (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Los Carneros, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is a steely and highly floral white containing just a smidgen of Muscat, while being soft, approachable and value-minded, with fruity secondary notes of apricot and fig.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Oberon 2018 Chardonnay (Los Carneros)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Bright, zesty aromas of lemon and lime peels meld with a bit of creamy pear on the nose. The medium-bodied palate is soft in feel, with mellow orchard fruit flavors lifted by gentle acidity.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Pellegrini Vineyards 2019 Stainless Steel Estate Grown Chardonnay (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: A streamlined nose of lemon, pineapple and steel starts off this zesty white. It's light and crisp on the palate, with demure peach and pineapple flavors that end with a creamy, yeasty vibe.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Bedell 2018 Chardonnay (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: The nose shows a perfumed jasmine element mixed with apple and pear. There's punch and gusto to the juicy yellow apple and lemon flavors on the medium-bodied palate, but it ends short.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Heron Hill 2019 Unoaked Chardonnay (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: This full-bodied superbuttery wine overflows with baking ingredients like nutmeg, vanilla and coconut. It's rich in texture, rather heavy on the palate and lets the pastry flavors take over the fruitiness.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Sobon Estate 2018 Chardonnay (California)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: A delicate nose of coconut and banana shows in this Chardonnay that has seen some time in older American oak. It's light on its feet, with easy melon and citrus flavors decently balanced by bright acidity.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Wagner 2019 Reserve Estate Bottled Chardonnay (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: A faint nose shows just hints of pear and crushed stone. The palate is rounded in feel yet light on its feet, displaying delicate citrus and orchard fruit flavors. It ends savory and yeasty, but with enough lift from bright acidity to bring balance.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Bright Leaf 2018 Chardonnay (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
