Description: Aromas of yellow plum and lemon carry a slightly toasty edge on the nose. The medium-bodied palate is rounded in feel, lifted by bright shots of lemony acidity. It ends creamy and savory, with a mild toasty grip.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Atwater 2017 Chardonnay (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This hearty white is brimming in green olive and fig, with a restrained use of oak and lingering note of celery seed.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Chalk Hill 2018 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Rich aromas of lemon furniture polish and preserved lemons carry the nose and palate. It shows an astringent, drying feel that's decently held in check by some nice creaminess.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Point of the Bluff 2018 Chardonnay (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Mendocino, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Flinty, doughy flavors dominate this dry and full-bodied wine made from certified organic grapes, giving it an austere, smoky character and a rather lean, tight texture.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Frey 2019 Biodynamic Chardonnay (Mendocino)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Muddled aromas of citrus and candied apple carry a yeasty funk on the nose. The palate is light in feel, with a slight lemon tone shining through a blanket of savory accents.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Harbes 2019 Steel Chardonnay (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Not a lot of fruit emerges on the nose, with a struck match aroma that holds court. It shows some gentle creaminess on the palate, with bright enough acidity to lend balance, but candied flowers and savory yeast tones are the dominate flavors.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Stony Lonesome 2018 Barrel Fermented Reserve Chardonnay (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Mendoza, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Harsh aromas of matchstick, burnt popcorn and stalky apple lead to a palate with little to no grip or elegance. Shallow buttered apple and white pepper flavors finish with stalky notes. Nothing about this Chardonnay impresses.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Terrazas de Los Andes 2019 Reserva High Altitude Vineyards Chardonnay (Mendoza)

Appellation: Mendoza, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: This large-format Chard opens with almost no color and lean aromas of white fruits and swimming pool chlorine. Briny apple and green onion flavors dissipate on a watery finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Funckenhausen 2019 Chardonnay (Mendoza)

Appellation: Champagne, Champagne, France
Description: Coming entirely from Grand Cru vineyards in the Côte des Blancs, the new release of this famous Champagne is from a top vintage year. The wine is at perfect maturity, poised between crisp, taut minerality and wonderful toastiness. It is intense, beautifully clear and limpid, a great Champagne. It is ready to drink now and for many years to come.                      Roger Voss
Designation: Comtes de Champagne Grands Crus Blanc de Blancs Brut
Name: Taittinger 2008 Comtes de Champagne Grands Crus Blanc de Blancs Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

Appellation: Eola-Amity Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: A sensational sophomore vintage for this Judy Jordan project, this wine is deep, dense and utterly delicious. It runs the gamut of ripe fruits, from citrus to stone fruits to tropical, all enveloped in a blanket of Butter Brickle, toasted cashews and caramel corn. The finish lasts for several minutes.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Geodesy 2018 Eola Springs Vineyard Chardonnay (Eola-Amity Hills)

Appellation: Canterbury, New Zealand
Description: Nestled amidst limestone boulders and one of only two wineries in the Waikari subregion of North Canterbury, Bell Hill is one of New Zealand's crown jewels. The 2012 Chard is downright beautiful. It needs time in decanter but will will hold up in the opened bottle for many days. It's linear, precise and gorgeously textured, with notes of lemon peel, guava, honeysuckle, flint and wild herbs, all hugged by fine, toasty oak. The finish is long and saline. There's stellar cellaring potential here. Drink until 2030 at least.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Bell Hill 2012 Chardonnay (Canterbury)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From the Zio Tony Vineyard, this beautifully exquisite white is cohesive and complex, a vibrant harmonization of golden apple, stone fruit and lemon rind. Refined tannin and oak temper the power and opulence, celebrated by a note of crème brûlée. The finish is marked by a texture and taste of wet stone and nutmeg.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Benovia 2018 La Pommeraie Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Yamhill-Carlton, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Hands-down the finest Chardonnay yet from BTF, this opens with scents of calla lilies, bee pollen, white pepper and butterscotch. Those details open into a deep palate focused on crisp lemon and apple fruit. The flavors keep compounding and lingering through a finish of toasted marshmallows.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Big Table Farm 2018 Chardonnay (Yamhill-Carlton)

Appellation: Südsteiermark, Austria
Description: Subtle smoke and toasted hazelnut combine on the gentle, subdued nose. The palate immediately hits with textured concentration buffered by an inherently cool chalkiness. Lemony brightness pervades everything while some of that nutty smoke lingers around the edges. This is sinuous and elegant, profound and supple. Drink 2022–2040.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Tement 2018 Ried Zieregg Morillon (Südsteiermark)

Appellation: Margaret River, Western Australia, Australia
Description: This vintage starts off with bright, bouncy aromas of peach, ground ginger, honey and buttered toast. The filigree palate is broad and layered, with a brightness to the acidity and a beautiful texture. The oak is there but in a supportive role. Length, concentration and class make this a modern Aussie Chard. Drink through 2035.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Cullen 2018 Kevin John Wilyabrup Chardonnay (Margaret River)

Appellation: North Canterbury, New Zealand
Description: Pyramid Valley shares the same corner of North Canterbury as Bell Hill, and both are renowned for making exceptional, artisanal Chardonnay and Pinot. This wine offers a heady mélange of lemon, honeysuckle, jasmine, salt and damp hay. Awesome acidity slices across the tongue. Mineral and tangy, it's precise and elegant yet scribbles outside the lines. Should cellar until 2030 at least.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Pyramid Valley 2018 Lion's Tooth Chardonnay (North Canterbury)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This wine offers incredible aromatics of crème brûlée and brioche, rich, warming characteristics that lead to more mineral-driven elements of oyster shell and stone. From several parts of the producer's estate, including Little Hill and River Block, this is a juicy, lengthy and beautifully structured wine, finishing in a swirl of grilled pineapple.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Rochioli 2018 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Canterbury, New Zealand
Description: Made in painfully small quantities, this gorgeous wine reveals layer after layer of honeysuckle, cantaloupe, oyster shell, flint and minerals, all laser-focused and buoyed by beautiful acidity and a chalky texture. More approachable than the 2012 vintage, this should age with exceptional grace for many years to come.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Bell Hill 2013 Chardonnay (Canterbury)

Appellation: Niederösterreich, Austria
Description: Notions of dried corn husk, hazelnut and gentle smoke rise from the glass. With more air, the nose gets more intense and smokier. The palate is intense in its freshness, its smokiness and its creaminess, combining flavors of lemon zest and corn husk. This is bold but fresh and insistent, with a lingering, lemony creaminess. Drink 2025–2040.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Ebner-Ebenauer 2018 Black Edition Chardonnay (Niederösterreich)

Appellation: Chehalem Mountains, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This wine is loaded with simply delicious flavors of buttered nuts, caramel crunch and tropical fruits, with a squeeze of citrus. Hints of seashell and pepper show that it's possible to retain delicate accents, even with ultraripe fruit and aging in 50% new French oak.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Geodesy 2018 Chehalem Mountain Vineyard Chardonnay (Chehalem Mountains)

Appellation: Südsteiermark, Austria
Description: Notes of struck match fill the nose with the first whiff. They dissipate to leave a sense of smoky creaminess behind. The fresh palate is slender but concentrated, presenting a juicy, smooth, creamy core that seems to hold Amalfi lemon sunshine. There is something beautiful, smooth but also edgy and zesty about this.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Hannes Sabathi 2018 Ried Jägerberg Chardonnay (Südsteiermark)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: With a crisp, light and floral entry, this wine develops into an impressively structured, complex and graceful beauty, full of underlying power. Green apple, pear and quince flavors ride along a supple texture of cohesive, harmonious balance and length.                      Virginie Boone
Name: DuMOL 2018 Wester Reach Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Südsteiermark, Austria
Description: A proper cloud of flinty, smoky reduction hangs over the nose, signalling both youthfulness and future promise. The plate also holds some of that smokiness but wonderfully creamy notes of ripe lemon and corn husk come through with both texture and intensity. This is very elegant and while it is lovely now, it will evolve. Drink 2022–2032.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Lackner Tinnacher 2017 Ried Flamberg Morillon (Südsteiermark)

Appellation: Yarra Valley, Victoria, Australia
Description: This fabulous bottling from a historic estate, this wine offers masses of personality, complexity and class. It opens with a slight reductive funk that adds rather than detracts. Pure citrus notes are balanced by salt, toast and mineral accents. The medium-weight palate is a harmonious combo of crunchy acidity, talc-like texture and minerals. The oak is subtle yet supportive. Drink now–2030.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Yeringberg 2018 Chardonnay (Yarra Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From the great site, this white opens in textured layers of anise, hazelnut and stone. Persistent flavors of lemon and tangerine give it additional elegance and a lively character, building to a refined, lengthy finish.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Gary Farrell 2018 Durell Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Simply dazzling in every way, this beguiles the taster immediately with a flower-and-pollen honeyed bouquet. The fruit is rich and mouthfilling, with apricot, peach and papaya, pear and melon. There's a vivid streak of butterscotch and impressive grip and power throughout a lingering finish. It's lip-smacking delicious and a wine that is simply impossible not to love at first sniff.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Haden Fig 2018 Juliette Chardonnay (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From the great site, this white opens in textured layers of anise, hazelnut and stone. Persistent flavors of lemon and tangerine give it additional elegance and a lively character, building to a refined, lengthy finish.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Gary Farrell 2018 Durell Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Simply dazzling in every way, this beguiles the taster immediately with a flower-and-pollen honeyed bouquet. The fruit is rich and mouthfilling, with apricot, peach and papaya, pear and melon. There's a vivid streak of butterscotch and impressive grip and power throughout a lingering finish. It's lip-smacking delicious and a wine that is simply impossible not to love at first sniff.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Haden Fig 2018 Juliette Chardonnay (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This latest bottling is more broadly sourced than previous vintages, including some fruit from the Van Duzer Corridor. It's a sappy, salty and delightful wine, with a juicy mix of apple, pear, apricot and peach. A seam of butterscotch fills out in the finish, along with well-integrated, toasty barrel highlights.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Lingua Franca 2018 Sisters Chardonnay (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: North Canterbury, New Zealand
Description: Made by Lynnette Hudson, formally of Pegasus Bay, this wine is vibrant yet delicate. It pulses with flavors of lemon oil, wildflowers and minerals. The palate is highly textural, crunching with acidity and crackling with minerality. There's oodles of lemony fruit and a saline finish in this long, elegant, ethereal and terroir-driven wine.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Pyramid Valley 2018 Chardonnay (North Canterbury)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is a juicy, broad and expansive white from the great coastal site, lengthy and balanced in a world of green apple, pear and salty brine. Nutmeg, clove and toast add to the savory nuance and impressive elegance.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Flanagan 2018 Platt Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: From a well-farmed site in the cooler climes of the appellation, this white sizzles in high-acid lifted layers of lemon and tangerine. Tremendously refreshing and refined, it has a graceful grip to the palate, textured in stone and mineral notes, pushing to a complex, lengthy finish of oyster shell and sea spray.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Donkey & Goat 2019 Linda Vista Vineyard Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Arroyo Grande Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Lightly seared apple slices, browned butter, roasted nuts and sea salt aromas make for a savory entry to the nose of this bottling. The tension is lively on the palate, where baked orange, seared lemon, pound cake and salted macadamia nuts meet with touches of chamomile and mint.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Talley 2018 Rincon Estate Bottled Chardonnay (Arroyo Grande Valley)

Appellation: Santa Maria Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Jim Clendenen saves his richer styles of Chardonnay for this family brand, and he remains a master of the style, adhering to balance while toying with woody lushness. Aromas of roasted nuts, toasted oak and butter meet with crisp and fresh citrus blossoms on the nose, while the viscous palate combines roasted apple, pecan and apple blossom flavors with bright acidity.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Clendenen Family 2016 Le Bon Climat Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

Appellation: Carneros, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is made entirely from estate-grown Chardonnay and given additional time in bottle: a Blanc de Blancs of great finesse and quality. Velvety texture supports an impressive palate of hazelnut, marzipan and brioche, with lasting notes of ginger and honey.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Domaine Carneros 2013 Le Reve Estate Grown Chardonnay Chardonnay (Carneros)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Made from entirely Chardonnay grapes grown at the producer's Martaella estate, this is a beautifully light, bright and pretty wine, aromatic in apple blossom and oyster shell. Flavors of Key lime, pear and stone underscore its core of lifted acidity and length of bubbly balance.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Benovia 2017 Blanc de Blancs Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Barrel fermented and put through complete malolactic fermentation, Sigrid is full and rich. The supple mouthfeel brings on lively flavors of clover, apple, fresh green herbs and a lick of butter. Elegant and detailed from start to finish, just a gentle touch of toast trails out on the lingering finish.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Bergström 2018 Sigrid Chardonnay (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Spring Mountain District, Napa, California, US
Description: This barrel-fermented white opens in oaky intensity before settling into flavors of kiwi, lime and green apple. Complex and structured, it has a graceful heartiness and offers tremendous value for the quality.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Smith-Madrone 2017 Estate Bottled Chardonnay (Spring Mountain District)

Appellation: Spring Mountain District, Napa, California, US
Description: This barrel-fermented white opens in oaky intensity before settling into flavors of kiwi, lime and green apple. Complex and structured, it has a graceful heartiness and offers tremendous value for the quality.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Smith-Madrone 2017 Estate Bottled Chardonnay (Spring Mountain District)

Appellation: Santa Lucia Highlands, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Aromas of nectarine, apricot and lemon blossom are precise yet rounded by hints of hazelnut and Marcona almond. There's a fierce line of laser-sharp acidity and limestone minerality on the palate, which cuts through the buttered apple and nectarine flavors, leading into a brioche finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Talbott 2018 Fidelity Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: A lovely blend from Carabella, Hyland, Meredith Mitchell and Winderlea Vineyards, this wine ravishes with a rich and succulent mouthfeel. It's loaded with peach and apricot flavors that are highlighted by bright apple and toast accents.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Winderlea 2018 Chardonnay (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Eola-Amity Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Slowly rounding the corner toward maturity, this wine begins with a soft, gently yielding impression of banana-cream pie. Fruit tones of apple and tropical fruit firm up the midpalate and gain concentration. The balancing acidity adds lime and grapefruit, with excellent length and concentration.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Authentique 2017 Fond Marin Chardonnay (Eola-Amity Hills)

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Weighty and rich with glycerine, this wine's flavors run from flowers to stone fruits, with stops along the way for citrus and baking spices. The underlying minerality that characterizes all the Bergström wines is here as well. All in all, it's the most complete of the three excellent single-vineyard Chardonnays made in 2018.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Bergström 2018 Bergström Vineyard Chardonnay (Dundee Hills)

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This has remarkable intensity right from the get-go, with deep and penetrating scents and flavors of lemon, lime and pineapple. The citrus fruit is accented with stiffer flavors of rind. Fermented in one-quarter new French barrels, the oak impact plays beautifully against the tart acids.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Archery Summit 2018 Chardonnay (Dundee Hills)

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This has remarkable intensity right from the get-go, with deep and penetrating scents and flavors of lemon, lime and pineapple. The citrus fruit is accented with stiffer flavors of rind. Fermented in one-quarter new French barrels, the oak impact plays beautifully against the tart acids.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Archery Summit 2018 Chardonnay (Dundee Hills)

Appellation: Rutherford, Napa, California, US
Description: Dark in color, this wine opens bright in acidity, tangy on the palate and uplifting of its fruit character, a mélange of mango, peach and pear. Almond and hazelnut flavors accent and complement, providing further length and complexity to the whole.                      Virginie Boone
Name: B Cellars 2018 Star Vineyard Chardonnay (Rutherford)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Floral on the nose and rich and grippy on the palate, this vineyard-designate tastes of baked apple and crème caramel. Opulently layered and textured, this wine retains enough acidity to complement the inherent richness with rewarding vibrancy and length.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Tongue Dancer 2018 Bacigalupi Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Aromatic in a richness of caramelized brioche and baked lemon, the layers of flavor in this full-bodied, voluptuous wine follow suit, providing plenty of length and opulence. A buttery back note adds to the complex, appealing intensity.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Patz & Hall 2018 Dutton Ranch Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Santa Lucia Highlands, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Rounded aromas of Asian pear and soft peach are cut by sharp grapefruit pith and chalk on the vibrant and very fresh nose of this stainless-steel expression. The palate is very grippy in texture at first, slowly giving way to the more broad stone-fruit flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Morgan 2019 Metallico Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

Appellation: North Canterbury, New Zealand
Description: Pyramid Valley lost 80% of its crop in the difficult 2018 vintage. Considering this, the wines shine. But Field of Fire, which comes from a more vigorous, southeast facing site, doesn't fare quite as well as Lion's Tooth. It's highly sulphuric, offerings tones of struck match, onion and salted nuts. With time in glass, the citrus and melon fruit float to the fore, as does the toasty oak. It's also richer and rounder than its counterpart, but the layers of texture are lifted by lovely acidity, a mineral line and a pithy finish.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Pyramid Valley 2018 Field of Fire Chardonnay (North Canterbury)

Appellation: North Canterbury, New Zealand
Description: Pyramid Valley lost 80% of its crop in the difficult 2018 vintage. Considering this, the wines shine. But Field of Fire, which comes from a more vigorous, southeast facing site, doesn't fare quite as well as Lion's Tooth. It's highly sulphuric, offerings tones of struck match, onion and salted nuts. With time in glass, the citrus and melon fruit float to the fore, as does the toasty oak. It's also richer and rounder than its counterpart, but the layers of texture are lifted by lovely acidity, a mineral line and a pithy finish.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Pyramid Valley 2018 Field of Fire Chardonnay (North Canterbury)

Appellation: Pago de Otazu, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Ripe apple, vanilla and light oak aromas convey a strong sense of quality, while this Navarran Chardonnay comes across as bright and elegant from first sip through the finish. Along the way look for apple, green melon and pear flavors and a fine mouthfeel. Drink through 2022.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Otazu 2017 Con Crianza Chardonnay (Pago de Otazu)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Superfresh aromas of lime blossom, lemongrass, Asian pear and lychee pop on the nose of this bottling. There is intense tension on the palate, where fresh orange blossom, crisp white fleshed fruits and hints of jasmine and tropical flowers ride into the tightly woven finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Au Bon Climat 2018 Los Alamos Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Ribbon Ridge, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: One of three single-vineyard Chardonnays from this vintage, this is spicy and focused, with bright apple fruit and a thin vein of vanilla. The barrel impact is more noticeable than in the blends—not surprising—and lending more individuality to this limited release. Wet rock minerality and a hint of pie crust nod to possible malolactic fermentation.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Bergström 2018 Le Pré du Col Vineyard Chardonnay (Ribbon Ridge)

Appellation: Chehalem Mountains, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: One of three single-vineyard Chardonnays released this vintage, this is notable for a hint of mint or menthol running across the palate. Crisp fruit flavors of apple and green pear, along with a sprinkling of fresh herbs, carry the flavors along on a deep dive down through the palate. As with Bergström's other Chardonnays, this is distinctive, detailed and very interesting.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Bergström 2018 Silice Chardonnay (Chehalem Mountains)

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Sourced from an outstanding vineyard and aged 11 months in 30% new French oak, this splendid Chardonnay is a mélange of ripe, crisp fruit—apples, oranges, tangerines and pink grapefruit. The acid balance is spot-on, and the new barrels bring light, toasty hints of buttered popcorn.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Elizabeth Chambers 2018 Durant Vineyard Chardonnay (Dundee Hills)

Appellation: Chehalem Mountains, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: One of three single-vineyard Chardonnays released this vintage, this is notable for a hint of mint or menthol running across the palate. Crisp fruit flavors of apple and green pear, along with a sprinkling of fresh herbs, carry the flavors along on a deep dive down through the palate. As with Bergström's other Chardonnays, this is distinctive, detailed and very interesting.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Bergström 2018 Silice Chardonnay (Chehalem Mountains)

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Sourced from an outstanding vineyard and aged 11 months in 30% new French oak, this splendid Chardonnay is a mélange of ripe, crisp fruit—apples, oranges, tangerines and pink grapefruit. The acid balance is spot-on, and the new barrels bring light, toasty hints of buttered popcorn.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Elizabeth Chambers 2018 Durant Vineyard Chardonnay (Dundee Hills)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Fresh and nicely detailed, this keeps an elegant frame around tangy nectarine, melon and papaya fruit. An especially good value for a first-class Oregon Chardonnay, its well-balanced acids lend structure and support to a flavorful finish. Aging 11 months in one-quarter new French oak adds highlights of caramel and toast.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Toil Oregon 2018 Chardonnay (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Vienna, Austria
Description: The sonorous notion of woodsmoke on a winter day fills the wine's nose with promise. That smokiness is also present on the palate and gives and edge to the beautiful lemon freshness and the more mellow, yeasty core. This is concentrated and serious, taut and bold but needs time to mellow. It will be serene, smoky and elegant. Drink 2022–2032.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Wieninger 2018 Select Chardonnay (Vienna)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Tasting of grapefruit, quince and honeycomb, this white is layered and full in feel. Structured tannins round out a fleshy midpalate of apple and pear flavors as notes of oak weigh in.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Williams Selyem 2018 Allen Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This full-bodied estate white shows strong flavors of lime, apple, green tea amd jasmine. Structured tannin and oak play a part in boosting its overall power and roundness, while moderate acidity remains well integrated.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Williams Selyem 2018 Lewis MacGregor Estate Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Wines with this new label are part of the Youngberg Hill portfolio and use those estate grapes. This is fresh and clean, with a driving minerality, and was barrel fermented in neutral oak. The flavors have a lovely purity, with cucumber, apple and melon fruits. It's not superripe, but well-detailed to showcase the elegance and subtlety of the vintage.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Bailey Family 2017 Chardonnay (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A soft, rounded white nicely layered in tropical and stone-fruit flavors, this is from a site planted in 1974 in the heart of the appellation. Bright and fleshy, it lingers in floral perfume and a touch of baking spice.                      Virginie Boone
Name: La Follette 2018 Lorenzo Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Aged in neutral French puncheons, the emphasis is on the crystal-clear, bright and textured estate-grown fruit. Textured with crisp citrus and appealing minerality, this brings apple, citrus and fresh parsley flavors together in an exceptionally clean and sculpted wine.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Lange 2019 Estate Chardonnay (Dundee Hills)

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This puncheon-fermented wine has especially pure and deep fruit flavors reflecting a cluster of different varieties of apples, along with a gentle hint of cucumber. It's lightly spicy, and the oak influence (63% was new) comes out in a lovely, toasty finish.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Stoller 2018 Elsie's Chardonnay (Dundee Hills)

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This estate-grown, barrel-fermented, reserve selection is full bodied and flush with highlights of toast and roasted cashews. There's a rich core of ripe peach and apricot, along with hints of tropical fruits such as papaya and guava. The acids bring a pleasant pineapple note.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Domaine Serene 2017 Récolte Grand Cru Chardonnay (Dundee Hills)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This well-balanced and wonderfully concentrated wine starts out quietly with subtle pear and baking spice aromas, then blossoms on the palate with expansive poached pear, honey and vanilla notes. It's rich in texture, full in body but lifted by good acidity.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Oak Farm 2019 Chardonnay (Lodi)

Appellation: Eola-Amity Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Brisk apple and citrus fruit holds center court here, with a slender thread of freshly cut green bean running through. Fermentation in one-third new French oak barrels rounds out the natural herbaceousness and adds a touch of toast to the finish.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Archery Summit 2018 Chardonnay (Eola-Amity Hills)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From the great site, this white is buttery and evocative of a vanilla cookie dusted in salt. Crushed rock, green apple and toasted oak add to the complex, savory mix. The wine is robust in bright flavor and subdued ripeness.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Flanagan 2018 Ritchie Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Alluring poached pear aromas and mouthfilling almond, pear and baking-spice flavors add up to an indulgent experience in this lush and full-bodied wine. Made from fruit from a steep hillside vineyard, it's been aging especially long in the cellar.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Scout & Grange 2016 Alder Springs Vineyard Chardonnay (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Arroyo Grande Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Subtle hints of macadamia nut, baked lemon meringue, butter and sea salt are presented in a mellow, subtle manner on the nose of this bottling, which would make a pleasant apéritif for any gathering. There's a taut frame to the sip, where lemon peel and lychee meet with a kiss of oak and a pinch of nutmeg.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Talley 2018 Chardonnay (Arroyo Grande Valley)

Appellation: Burgenland, Austria
Description: Vanilla, smoke and hazelnut make for a toasty aroma on the mellow, smooth nose. Underneath that lurk slightly funkier notions of yeast, butter and apple peel. The palate is as creamy as the nose promised, as lactic as those buttery notes suggested, yet there is a freshness at the core. This ultrarich wine should appeal to lovers of oaked Chardonnay.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Steindorfer 2017 Golden Cut Chardonnay (Burgenland)

Appellation: Arroyo Grande Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Delicate aromas of yellow apple, daffodil, lemon blossom and light butter show on the nose of this single-vineyard expression. Familiar and comforting on the palate, the wine lands softly, with poached orange, light butter and delicate oak flavors, leading into a more complex finish of chamomile and cashew.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Talley 2018 Rosemary's Chardonnay (Arroyo Grande Valley)

Appellation: Burgenland, Austria
Description: Vanilla, smoke and hazelnut make for a toasty aroma on the mellow, smooth nose. Underneath that lurk slightly funkier notions of yeast, butter and apple peel. The palate is as creamy as the nose promised, as lactic as those buttery notes suggested, yet there is a freshness at the core. This ultrarich wine should appeal to lovers of oaked Chardonnay.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Steindorfer 2017 Golden Cut Chardonnay (Burgenland)

Appellation: Arroyo Grande Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Delicate aromas of yellow apple, daffodil, lemon blossom and light butter show on the nose of this single-vineyard expression. Familiar and comforting on the palate, the wine lands softly, with poached orange, light butter and delicate oak flavors, leading into a more complex finish of chamomile and cashew.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Talley 2018 Rosemary's Chardonnay (Arroyo Grande Valley)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Macadamia nut and baked apple aromas meet with a hint of baking spice and a linear, steely minerality on the nose of this bottling. There's a grippy, rain-on-cement-like minerality and chalky texture to the palate, with lime skin and jasmine leading into a finish of vanilla bean.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Au Bon Climat 2018 Sanford & Benedict Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Always a fine value, the latest Old Stones puts an emphasis on fresh, juicy citrus fruits, a hint of pineapple, and a compelling wet stone minerality. There's good definition throughout, and the flavors cut a clean swath across the palate and down through a finish, hinting lightly at barrel toast.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Bergström 2018 Old Stones Chardonnay (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Santa Lucia Highlands, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Very showy aromas of tart lime deftly slice into the salted butter, baked pear and cinnamon spice on the nose of this bottling, which manages to be zesty while carrying the region's typical richness. The palate is tense with citrus pith texture, offering singed nectarine, apricot and salted Meyer lemon-rind flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Boekenoogen 2018 Stainless Steel Fermented Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Floral and mineral-driven, this coastal wine delivers a stoniness of green apple and pear—crisp, defined flavors that lead to a complementary spread of brioche and toasted oak. Hearty and rich, it has balance and concentration.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Patz & Hall 2018 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Washington, Washington Other, Washington, US
Description: This wine is mostly estate fruit, along with a dash (13%) from Celilo Vineyard's 1980 plantings. The aromas pull you in, with notes of pear, yellow apple, star fruit and kisses of pineapple and spice, showing an appealing purity. The palate has concentration and richness, but also exquisite balance and dexterity. Lemony notes persist on the finish. The acid balance is spot on, and as always with this producer, it's all about grace and subtlety. Give it some additional time in bottle to see it at its best.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Woodward Canyon 2019 Chardonnay (Washington)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Floral and mineral-driven, this coastal wine delivers a stoniness of green apple and pear—crisp, defined flavors that lead to a complementary spread of brioche and toasted oak. Hearty and rich, it has balance and concentration.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Patz & Hall 2018 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Sharp lime and grapefruit-peel aromas meet with warmer touches of nectarine and peach on the nose of this bottling, which also offers intriguing herb and earth scents. It's racy upon hitting the palate, full of lemon and orange-rind elements, as well as chalk and sea-salt warmth. The pithy texture carries deep into the finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Alfaro Family 2018 Lindsay Paige Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: Eola-Amity Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: In this vintage, this wine reaches new heights of richness. It's a leesy, creamy mouthful, which touches broadly on banana-cream pie. It's a buttery palate-coater, underscored with wet rock minerality. As it fades away, the lingering impression is butter cookie. Yum!                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Big Table Farm 2018 Chardonnay (Eola-Amity Hills)

Appellation: Chehalem Mountains, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Fermented and aged in a single puncheon, this is packed with bright citrus fruit running through lemon, lime and grapefruit. Those forward, potent fruit flavors conjure up suggestions of Mountain Dew without the sugar, but there's much more going on in terms of depth and overall balance. It's nice counterpoint to the regular, stainless-fermented Chardonnay.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Vidon Vineyard 2018 Apollo Chardonnay (Chehalem Mountains)

Appellation: Chehalem Mountains, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This crisp and well-structured wine is replete with flavors of green apple and melon, backed with fresh, mineral-drenched acids. It's a perfect food wine—assertive yet malleable, with a balanced, sculpted mouthfeel and great penetration. It finishes with a lick of butterscotch as you reach to refill your glass.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Vidon Vineyard 2018 Chardonnay (Chehalem Mountains)

Appellation: Eola-Amity Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Scents of flint, toast and cream open the door to a lovely wine centered around ripe and pretty nectarine fruit. Nicely focused and deep, the flavors show spicy wood highlights as well as a lingering finish which resolves in a wash of toasted hazelnuts. Credit 18 months in 30% new French oak.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Bryn Mawr Vineyards 2017 Estate Chardonnay (Eola-Amity Hills)

Appellation: Beaujolais Blanc, Beaujolais, France
Description: This spicy, wood-aged wine is balanced and rich. Toastiness balances with green-plum and red-apple fruits to give a full-bodied, ripe wine that is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine du Penlois 2018 Le Chêne du Châtelard  (Beaujolais Blanc)

Appellation: Yamhill-Carlton, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This lush wine is sourced from an estate vineyard and barrel fermented in neutral French oak. Sappy and sexy, it hits the palate with rich flavors of apple sauce and peach pie, along with accents of toasted hazelnuts. Despite the implied decadence, it's firmly anchored in vivid acids that keep it lively.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Furioso 2018 Trovato Vineyard Chardonnay (Yamhill-Carlton)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Crisp, high-toned acidity lights the way to a fresh palate of lovely apple and pear notes in this layered, balanced and complex wine. Complementary oak spice seasons the fruit, adding a length of nutmeg and wild vanilla.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Flanagan 2018 The Beauty of Three Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Production has doubled on this excellent blend. It's loaded with tangy fruit flavors of peach, nectarine and green banana. Fermentation included 40% done in concrete, which brings some drying minerality, and the rest in a mix of new and neutral French oak, which helps to soften the profile. There's a nice touch of butter as the finish fades out.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Lange 2019 Three Hills Cuvée Chardonnay (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Australia, Australia Other, Australia
Description: This is a likable, multi-regional Chardonnay blend that is at first tightly reined and straightforward in nature, but reveals more layers as it opens in the glass. It weaves stone fruit, pineapple, salted nuts and toasty characters into a slippery, creamy mouthfeel. The oak is present but not overwhelming and an appealing salted peach note lingers on the finish. It's a solid example of modern Aussie Chardonnay.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Penfolds 2019 Bin 311 Chardonnay (Australia)

Appellation: Yarra Valley, Victoria, Australia
Description: This premium Chardonnay is a classy bottling that emulates high-end Burgundy. Reductive at first, aromas of gun flint, salt and onion dominate. Eventually stone fruit squeaks through and more layers emerge with air and warmth. Polished, vanillin oak is present on the full-bodied palate, which offers a lovely texture and great fruit concentration. Drink 2021–2035.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Levantine Hill 2016 Katherine's Paddock Chardonnay (Yarra Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Effusively bright and high-toned, this wine offers a demure imprint of oak on the nose. It then evolves to show complex contrasts of ginger, Meyer lemon and jasmine—an effectively cohesive, harmonious and lengthy expression of understated fruit.                      Virginie Boone
Name: MacRostie 2018 Mirabelle Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Eola-Amity Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This tangy wine was barrel fermented and aged in 18% new French oak. Juicy citrus, apple and peach fruit is well integrated, and a whiff of flint continues on into the finish. This has exceptional flavor and finesse for its price.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Bryn Mawr Vineyards 2018 Eola-Amity Hills Chardonnay (Eola-Amity Hills)

Appellation: Oregon, Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: The winery notes suggest piña colada as a principal flavor. There's pineapple fruit and maybe a hint of rum, along with green banana and melon. Separate lots were barrel-aged for a year and a half prior to blending, and a nice light touch of caramel comes out in the finished wine.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Eola Hills 2018 Barrel Select Reserve Chardonnay (Oregon)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Made by Winemaker Leo Hansen from a majority of grapes grown at Stuhlmuller Vineyards, where the Alexander and Russian River valleys converge, this white is creamy and tropical, with lingering notes of stone fruit, vanilla and pear. Balanced acidity tempers the richness with ease and elegance.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Stillman St. 2018 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This Chardonnay saw no new oak and had minimal malolactic fermentation.  The aromas are all about subtlety with its notes of spice, apple and Bosc pear. The flavors are full of grace and balance, bringing vibrancy and freshness.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Woodward Canyon 2019 Estate Vineyard Chardonnay (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This wine has a great opening nose of apple and lemon, flavors that follow on the sleek midpalate. Spicy oak and dense concentration further define its charms—a balanced weightiness that provides texture and complexity.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Flanagan 2018 Bacigalupi Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Santa Maria Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Hazelnut, butter-poached lemon, squeezed mandarin and light macadamia nut aromas make for a wondrous nose on this bottling by Bob Lindquist. Yellow pear skins, grapefruit peels and a touch of guava show on the palate, which is pithy in texture.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Lindquist Family 2019 Bien Nacido Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Rather subdued aromas are followed by zesty lemon and Bosc pear flavors in this full-bodied, lean but complex wine. While unoaked, it offers nuances of toasted almond on the palate along with hints of butter and vanilla, all carried by good acidity. Best through 2025.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Scout & Grange 2015 Alder Springs Vineyard Chardonnay (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: A mineral-driven opening leads to a quiet, understated richness on the midpalate of this wine. Crisp and bright, as underlying acidity freshens layers of wet stone, pear and green apple, the oak is well integrated and in check.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Textbook 2018 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Yarra Valley, Victoria, Australia
Description: A relatively ripe, rich style of Chardonnay, this nevertheless delivers oodles of citrus, melon, salted nut, seashell and toasty, creamy oak. There's lovely, tingly acidity on the palate that buoys the creamy mouthfeel. It's a fruity but balanced wine, with length and crowd appeal.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Handpicked 2017 Regional Selections Chardonnay (Yarra Valley)

Appellation: Eola-Amity Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This low abv but delicious wine paints a promising picture for future vintages of Project M Chardonnay. Buttery, lemony flavors are focused on apple and white-peach fruit, with a touch of thyme adding welcome herbal highlights.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Project M 2018 Annicca Chardonnay (Eola-Amity Hills)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From the long-standing grape grower's Goddard Ranch, on the westside of Westside Road, this rich, layered wine traffics in caramel, toasted apple and baked pineapple. Lush and opulent in style, it is rounded and rich, finishing in a moderate trace of acidity.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Bacigalupi 2018 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Ripe peach, sharp Meyer lemon-juice, pineapple and butterscotch aromas come through on this bottling by a winery that was nearly lost during the Glass Fire. There's a briny character to the sip, where dried honeysuckle and Meyer lemon-peel flavors slide into a caramel finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Castello di Amorosa 2018 Bien Nacido Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Yarra Valley, Victoria, Australia
Description: A relatively ripe, rich style of Chardonnay, this nevertheless delivers oodles of citrus, melon, salted nut, seashell and toasty, creamy oak. There's lovely, tingly acidity on the palate that buoys the creamy mouthfeel. It's a fruity but balanced wine, with length and crowd appeal.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Handpicked 2017 Regional Selections Chardonnay (Yarra Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This wine is a tribute to the vineyard's matriarch, Helen Bacigalupi, and the site's place in history, providing Chardonnay grapes to the winning Chateau Montelena wine of the 1976 Paris Tasting. Hearty and full, it is indeed sourced from the Paris Tasting Block of the Goddard Ranch, and offers a creamy, opulent and robust experience of sea spray, oak and baking spice over Asian pear and green-apple flavor.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Bacigalupi 2018 Renouveau Bacigalupi Vineyards Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: San Luis Obispo County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This broader market brand from Talley is a screaming deal, as shown on the subdued nose of this bottling, which offers chiseled stone, apple skin and lime zest. The palate is expertly tense and chalky, delivering lime-peel and wet slate flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Bishop's Peak 2018 Chardonnay (San Luis Obispo County)

Appellation: Eola-Amity Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Sharply defined, energetic and tightly wound, this pushes tart lemony fruit front and center. The flavors are clean, crisp and persistent, with a compelling freshness. The best drinking window should open in 2023 and run through the rest of the decade or longer.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Bryn Mawr Vineyards 2018 Estate Chardonnay (Eola-Amity Hills)

Appellation: Eola-Amity Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Sharply defined, energetic and tightly wound, this pushes tart lemony fruit front and center. The flavors are clean, crisp and persistent, with a compelling freshness. The best drinking window should open in 2023 and run through the rest of the decade or longer.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Bryn Mawr Vineyards 2018 Estate Chardonnay (Eola-Amity Hills)

Appellation: Mendocino, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This medium-bodied wine is graceful and well balanced, offering crisp lemon and green-apple flavors on a rather lean, tangy texture. It is nuanced and complex, and has a nice tension from tantalizing acidity.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Saracina 2019 Unoaked Chardonnay (Mendocino)

Appellation: Sicilia, Sicily & Sardinia, Italy
Description: Fermented and aged in wood, this opens with aromas of toasted oak, hazelnut, ripe stone fruit and eucalyptus. Reflecting the nose, the smooth, polished palate features ripe yellow apple, butterscotch and candied lemon alongside a hint of fennel seed. Fresh acidity brightens the rich flavors.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tasca d'Almerita 2018 Vigna San Francesco Chardonnay (Sicilia)

Appellation: Beaujolais-Villages Blanc, Beaujolais, France
Description: This grand estate with vineyards surrounding Mont Brouilly has produced a ripe, creamy and richly fruity Chardonnay. Aged in wood, it has spice as well as touches of yellow fruits and honey. Drink the wine now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château de Pierreux 2019  Beaujolais-Villages Blanc

Appellation: Waipara, New Zealand
Description: This is a fresh, fruity and regionally expressive Chardonnay, with delicate notes of peach, melon, yeasty apple and mineral nuances. Considering it has some bottle age, it still has fresh acidity typical to the region balanced neatly by a slippery texture and a fresh, tangy finish. Drink now.                      Christina Pickard
Name: The Boneline 2016 Barebone Chardonnay (Waipara)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: With its rich nose of tropical opulence, this white shines in oak, caramel apple and buttery goodness, a full-bodied expression of the grape that shows good farming and good winemaking in harmony.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Jax 2019 Dutton Ranch Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Beaujolais Blanc, Beaujolais, France
Description: From a walled vineyard in southern Beaujolais, this rich, lemon- and apricot-flavored wine has some wood aging to bring out the fruit and add a touch of spice. This warm wine is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Thivin 2019 Clos de Rochebonne  (Beaujolais Blanc)

Appellation: Chehalem Mountains, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: All-stainless fermentation and aging puts an emphasis on bright, fresh fruit first and foremost. Ripe enough to feel deliciously sappy, this mixes Meyer lemon, pineapple and mixed citrus in a generous, lingering palate.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Chehalem 2019 INOX Unoaked Chardonnay (Chehalem Mountains)

Appellation: Beaujolais Blanc, Beaujolais, France
Description: This rich, full-bodied white wine comes from southern Burgundy. With its full and creamy character and yellow fruits touched by citrus, this dense wine is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaines Chermette 2019 Collonge  (Beaujolais Blanc)

Appellation: Beaujolais-Villages Blanc, Beaujolais, France
Description: A generous and ripe wine from a four-acre parcel of Chardonnay, this has been aged in wood for nine months. Wellbalanced between toastiness and wood, the wine is rich and fresh. The smoky aftertaste is attractively shot through with fresh, citrus acidity. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château de Durette 2019 Cuvée Prestige  (Beaujolais-Villages Blanc)

Appellation: Conca de Barberà, Catalonia, Spain
Description: Slightly prickly aromas of apple, passion fruit and oak introduce a full palate. Briny apple flavors include a pop of scallion and green herbs, while this single-vineyard Chardonnay is steady on a finish held together by acidity. Drink now.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Torres 2017 Milmanda Chardonnay (Conca de Barberà)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This vintage is big step up for this affordable Chardonnay. Fragrant with hints of lightly toasted cashews, and bursting with fruit flavors of melon and apple, this is lightly buttery in the mouth, with ongoing highlights of green pineapple, Meyer lemon and a delicious squirt of orange.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: R. Stuart & Co. 2018 Love, Oregon Chardonnay (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This bright, spicy wine is made entirely in stainless tanks, showcasing crisp apple fruit with side notes of green pear and white peach. Despite the low listed alcohol it does not feel underripe, just fresh and bracing with ample acidity.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Stoller 2019 Chardonnay (Dundee Hills)

Appellation: Oregon, Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: Part of the "classic" series, this wine is apple pie in a bottle. Soft, toasty and accessible, it's ready to enjoy and a fine example of why Oregon vintners are knocking it out of the park with this variety. Just a slight hint of bitterness frames it, but at this price it's a bargain.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Eola Hills 2017 Chardonnay (Oregon)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Poached pear, daffodil and lemon-candy aromas make for a rich yet fresh entry to the nose of this bottling. There's a pleasant acidic pop to the sip, where pecan, lemonpeel, toast and apple-butter flavors lead into a plumeria-kissed finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Le Vigne 2019 Di Domenico Barrel Select Chardonnay (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Carneros, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Description: Crisp and earthy, with a rocky mineral component that adds grip and grit, this is a high-toned white, with effusive floral aromas and a depth of fruity flavor. Gravenstein apple, pear and Meyer lemon characteristics are seasoned in a lengthy dash of nutmeg.                      Virginie Boone
Name: MacRostie 2018 Sangiacomo Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: With a mix of olive, brine and green apple, this white is creamy and lush in style, with a healthy structure and lasting notes of toasted oak. Ultimately, it finds a balance between the savory and rich, finishing in a cohesive whole.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Red Mare 2016 Dutton Ranch Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Eola-Amity Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Scents of apple and citrus introduce broad flavors of apple and green melon that spread across the palate. Aged 10 months in 20% new oak, it amps up the finish with accents of biscuit and butter.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Elton 2018 Chardonnay (Eola-Amity Hills)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Waxy and reductive at first, this white offers ample layers of apple, lemon rind and oak, with a balanced approach to ripeness and richness. Crisp acidity floats throughout, complementing the deeper concentrations of fruit and oak.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Gundlach Bundschu 2018 Rhinefarm Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Eola-Amity Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Scents of apple and citrus introduce broad flavors of apple and green melon that spread across the palate. Aged 10 months in 20% new oak, it amps up the finish with accents of biscuit and butter.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Elton 2018 Chardonnay (Eola-Amity Hills)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas offer subdued notes of barrel spice, lees, pear and kisses of tropical fruit. A mix of tropical fruit flavors follow. It's an unabashedly full bodied offering of the variety.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Dance 2018 Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This vineyard-designated wine from the warmer folds of the appellation is robustly built in layers of tropical fruit and Gravenstein apple dusted in nutmeg and vanilla oak. It has a nearly carbonic-like liveliness to its bright acidity.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Domaine de la Rivière 2018 Flora Marie Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Crisp apple, Meyer lemon and tangerine flavors make for a fresh, fruity experience on the medium-bodied palate, while the wine shows balance and elegance throughout. Floral apple blossom and jasmine add to the liveliness and appeal.                      Virginie Boone
Name: MacRostie 2018 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This is a leap forward in both quality and quantity for this budget-friendly Chardonnay. It's clean, precise and well constructed, with a tasty mix of toasted almonds, butter cream, crisp apples and light citrus. A fine expression of Willamette Valley grapes, enjoy this now–2024.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Sokol Blosser 2019 Evolution Chardonnay (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Carneros, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Description: Lovely in light tropical-fruit flavors, this wine also offers well-defined, quenching acidity and floral aromas. Light bodied and balanced, the highlights range from melon to lemon zest to fig.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Fleur de California 2018 Carneros Select Chardonnay (Carneros)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Crisp apple, Meyer lemon and tangerine flavors make for a fresh, fruity experience on the medium-bodied palate, while the wine shows balance and elegance throughout. Floral apple blossom and jasmine add to the liveliness and appeal.                      Virginie Boone
Name: MacRostie 2018 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Eola-Amity Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Bright and spicy, pungent and loaded with flavors of white peach, lemon rind and pineapple sage, this is a complex and nicely layered wine with the structure to improve. Barrel fermented in half new French oak, it finishes with a touch of toast.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Iota Cellars 2018 Pelos Sandberg Vineyard Chardonnay (Eola-Amity Hills)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: Mango, guava and pineapple flavors rise to the fore of this light-bodied white, which offers just a hint of underlying butterscotch and crème brûlée. The oak is well behaved.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Long Meadow Ranch 2018 Farmstead Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Slatey, earthy and salty, this vineyard-designate shows a wealth of hearty stone-fruit flavor. Robust and rounded, it has a flourish of floral aromas that complement the fruit well, finishing in a fresh hit of acidity.                      Virginie Boone
Name: MacRostie 2018 Bacigalupi Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Chehalem Mountains, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: There's a strong scent and flavor of freshly ground black pepper, and overall this is fairly lean, though well balanced. Citrus, green-apple and celery flavors stand in for riper fruit, but this could prove to be a friendly match for light seafood and shellfish.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Carabella 2018 Dijon Clones Chardonnay (Chehalem Mountains)

Appellation: Sicilia, Sicily & Sardinia, Italy
Description: Aromas of white spring flower mingle with ripe pear and Mediterranean scrub on the nose. The light-bodied, polished palate recalls creamy yellow apple, citrus and a hint of vanilla alongside bright acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Caruso & Minini 2019 Cusora Chardonnay (Sicilia)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Orange and Meyer lemon-cream flavors are smooth and clean on the nose of this bottling, which also shows a hint of baked apple. There's a decent grip to the sip, where golden apple, toasted nut and seared orange-peel flavors converge.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Summerland 2019 Chardonnay (Central Coast)

Appellation: Beaujolais-Villages Blanc, Beaujolais, France
Description: This rich wine offers ripe yellow fruits, and a generous, full-bodied texture. Along with ripe fruit flavors, the wine has a hint of pepper and the lightest touch of acidity at the end. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Robert Perroud 2019 Terres Blanches  (Beaujolais-Villages Blanc)

Appellation: Santa Lucia Highlands, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Singed lemon-peel and light sage aromas meet with slightly funky earthy elements on the nose of this bottling. There's a wet clay minerality to the sip, where dried lemon and green-herb flavors align.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Talbott 2018 Sleepy Hollow Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Tropical aromas of ripe melon, guava and plumeria meet with a steely minerality on the nose of this bottling. The palate tightens around lemongrass and Meyer lemon-pith flavors, with those riper guava-flesh flavors returning by the finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Donati Family Vineyard 2019 Sisters Forever Un-Oaked Chardonnay (Central Coast)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Aromas of blistered orange, light butter and clean oak show on the nose of this bottling. There's a bright zest to the sip, where citrus-peel and citrus-juice flavors meet with roasted apple flavors and a lightly grippy texture.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Rancho Sisquoc 2018 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Aromas of blistered orange, light butter and clean oak show on the nose of this bottling. There's a bright zest to the sip, where citrus-peel and citrus-juice flavors meet with roasted apple flavors and a lightly grippy texture.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Rancho Sisquoc 2018 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: This buttery, rich, supple wine really pours on the dairy flavors and baking spices. Melted butter dominates the aromas, butterscotch and cream flood the palate while vanilla, nutmeg and ginger add a pastrylike touch.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Harken 2019 Chardonnay (California)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This concrete-aged bottling shows much potential, starting with aromas of baked nectarine, peach blossom and hints of caramel apple. There's a tight weave to the palate, which holds the ripe flavors of apple, gardenia and plumeria mostly in check.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Brick Barn 2019 Beton Chardonnay (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Toasty with plenty of new oak richness, this medium-gold wine should please lovers of the old-school style. The apple flavors have an autumnal edge of extra ripeness, and there are additional flavors of butter cookie and roasted cashews. Drink over the next couple of years.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Naumes 2017 Chardonnay (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Beaujolais-Villages Blanc, Beaujolais, France
Description: This wood-aged wine is ripe, full of yellow fruits as well as touches of toast. The creamy texture is lifted by an edge of lime acidity that merges into a rounded, full aftertaste. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine du Château de Grand Pré 2019  Beaujolais-Villages Blanc
Winery: Domaine du Château de Grand Pré

Appellation: Beaujolais Blanc, Beaujolais, France
Description: A light, poised and fruity wine, this is a pair with a red of the same name. Attractive acidity and an orange and melon fruitiness give this wine structure and a refreshing aftertaste. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Joncy 2019 Hédoniste Blanc  (Beaujolais Blanc)

Appellation: Beaujolais Blanc, Beaujolais, France
Description: A light, poised and fruity wine, this is a pair with a red of the same name. Attractive acidity and an orange and melon fruitiness give this wine structure and a refreshing aftertaste. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Joncy 2019 Hédoniste Blanc  (Beaujolais Blanc)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: The vineyard is located in the Yamhill-Carlton AVA (not listed as such on the label). Barrel fermented in one-quarter new oak, this low-alcohol wine has plenty of acid, but the barrel impact is also quite evident as it rolls crisp lemon and apple fruit into the finish. The mouthfeel softens and buttery, toasty highlights emerge. It needs more bottle age to pull itself together, so let it rest a few months.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Le Doubblé Troubblé 2018 Janice Vineyard Chardonnay (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas jump up, with notes of green cantaloupe, kiwi, pineapple and pear. A fruit-filled palate follows. It drinks more like a tropical Pinot Gris than Chardonnay but still delivers plenty of enjoyment.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Lone Birch 2019 Chardonnay (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Clear, bright and weighty on the midpalate, this likable wine is balanced in richness and roundness, tasting of melon, guava and apple. The oak is complementary and largely integrated, with a creaminess building to the finish.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Reata 2018 Jamieson Ranch Vineyards Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Monterey County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Orange-peel, pear-flesh and honeysuckle aromas are very expressive on the nose of this bottling. The palate is quite broad and nearly sweet, with ripe pear and apple flavors cut by lemony acidity.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: 10Span 2018 Chardonnay (Monterey County)

Appellation: Sicilia, Sicily & Sardinia, Italy
Description: Aromas of yellow spring flower, toasted bread and balsamic notes follow over to the rounded, full-bodied palate along with yellow apple and a hint of wild herb. A coffee note lingers on the close while tangy acidity lends freshness.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Baglio del Cristo di Campobello 2018 Laudàri Chardonnay (Sicilia)

Appellation: Monterey County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Orange-peel, pear-flesh and honeysuckle aromas are very expressive on the nose of this bottling. The palate is quite broad and nearly sweet, with ripe pear and apple flavors cut by lemony acidity.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: 10Span 2018 Chardonnay (Monterey County)

Appellation: Sicilia, Sicily & Sardinia, Italy
Description: Aromas of yellow spring flower, toasted bread and balsamic notes follow over to the rounded, full-bodied palate along with yellow apple and a hint of wild herb. A coffee note lingers on the close while tangy acidity lends freshness.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Baglio del Cristo di Campobello 2018 Laudàri Chardonnay (Sicilia)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Fermented in neutral barrels, this brings crisp flavors of apple flesh and skin, with a thin vein of buttery acids. It's a pleasant though blocky wine, with sturdy components but simple construction.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Carabella 2019 Plowbuster Reserve Chardonnay (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Beaujolais Blanc, Beaujolais, France
Description: A ripe and creamy wine with light acidity and rich yellow-fruit flavors, this is full and ready to drink. The acidity adds enough freshness as well as hints of citrus. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Vignerons de Bel Air 2019  Beaujolais Blanc

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Clear, bright and weighty on the midpalate, this likable wine is balanced in richness and roundness, tasting of melon, guava and apple. The oak is complementary and largely integrated, with a creaminess building to the finish.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Reata 2018 Jamieson Ranch Vineyards Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: The vineyard is located in the Yamhill-Carlton AVA (not listed as such on the label). Barrel fermented in one-quarter new oak, this low-alcohol wine has plenty of acid, but the barrel impact is also quite evident as it rolls crisp lemon and apple fruit into the finish. The mouthfeel softens and buttery, toasty highlights emerge. It needs more bottle age to pull itself together, so let it rest a few months.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Le Doubblé Troubblé 2018 Janice Vineyard Chardonnay (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas jump up, with notes of green cantaloupe, kiwi, pineapple and pear. A fruit-filled palate follows. It drinks more like a tropical Pinot Gris than Chardonnay but still delivers plenty of enjoyment.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Lone Birch 2019 Chardonnay (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This is much in the same style as the Vintage 45 bottling, also from this vineyard, but this one got slightly less new oak during its 10 months of aging. Clean apple fruit, moderate acids and barrel toast that is smoothly integrated push it a notch ahead in terms of drinkability. Less new oak seems to be a better choice for fruit from this vineyard.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Willamette Valley Vineyards 2018 Tualatin Estate Chardonnay (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Sicilia, Sicily & Sardinia, Italy
Description: Crisp and refreshing, this opens with delicate scents recalling white spring flower, white stone and citrus. The vibrant palate offers yellow apple, juicy grapefruit and a hint of pineapple alongside bright acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Fondo Antico 2019 Lumière Chardonnay (Sicilia)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Limited to just a few barrels, this vineyard select is anchored in tight flavors of apple and peach, which billow out across the palate with soft touches of meringue and whipped cream. It's an easy-drinking, forward and fruity style, but the compact core and the soft, almost hazy mouthfeel seem mismatched.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: King Estate 2018 Kennel Vineyard Chardonnay (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Pale gold in color, this wine was aged 16 months sur lie. The aromas bring notes of musk, lemon curd, nut and lees. It's thick, almost viscous, in feel, showing its age but still holding quite well.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Wanaka 2012 Wallula Vineyard Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This full-bodied, oaky style wine is powerful and flavorful but doesn't get out of hand. It offers a good, mouthcleansing texture to balance out the butter, toasted oak and vanilla that fill the palate.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Page Mill Winery 2019 VS Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Aged in American oak for a short time, this value-minded white is moderate in acidity and structure, marked by rich layers of pineapple and guava. The backbone is seasoned by the oak, adding flavors of baking spice and vanilla.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Pedroncelli 2018 Signature Selection Chardonnay (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Beaujolais Blanc, Beaujolais, France
Description: A rounded, ripe wine with creamed apple and pear flavors, this is balanced by zesty freshness that works with the touches of acidity. The texture is already integrated with the cushioning fruits. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Agnès Pegaz 2019  Beaujolais Blanc

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of cantaloupe, pear and white flower leap out of the glass. Light, zippy kiwi and other tropical flavors follow. It doesn't necessarily scream Chardonnay but it's tasty all the same.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Airfield Estates 2019 Chardonnay (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Limited to just a few barrels, this vineyard select is anchored in tight flavors of apple and peach, which billow out across the palate with soft touches of meringue and whipped cream. It's an easy-drinking, forward and fruity style, but the compact core and the soft, almost hazy mouthfeel seem mismatched.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: King Estate 2018 Kennel Vineyard Chardonnay (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This may or may not have spent any time in wood, but what shows clearly at first is the acidic, steely apple fruit of tank-fermented Chardonnay. That is set against a back half that smooths out with a hint of butter, suggesting partial malolactic. The fruit continues with apple, lemon and pineapple components. This should benefit from another year or two of bottle age.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Del Rio 2019 Chardonnay (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Carneros, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Description: This estate-grown white has an herbal, earthy quality, mixing together wet stone with hay and pine. Soft, supple and lengthy, it offers balanced acidity and lasting richness.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Domaine Carneros 2018 Tula Vista Chardonnay (Carneros)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Opening in a buttery nose of rich smoothness, it remains round and robustly ripe on the palate, showing a density of melon and pear. Tropical vanilla highlights the dense, chewy finish.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Au Contraire 2018 Reserve Mighty Mouse Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Young and raw, this Dijon 76 clone wine could use a bit more bottle age. Barrel fermentation brings sharp, slightly bitter oak flavors front and center, around clean but simple apple and citrus fruit. Cellar a few months or aggressively aerate it.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Ermisch 2019 Chardonnay (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This may or may not have spent any time in wood, but what shows clearly at first is the acidic, steely apple fruit of tank-fermented Chardonnay. That is set against a back half that smooths out with a hint of butter, suggesting partial malolactic. The fruit continues with apple, lemon and pineapple components. This should benefit from another year or two of bottle age.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Del Rio 2019 Chardonnay (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Carneros, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Description: This estate-grown white has an herbal, earthy quality, mixing together wet stone with hay and pine. Soft, supple and lengthy, it offers balanced acidity and lasting richness.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Domaine Carneros 2018 Tula Vista Chardonnay (Carneros)

Appellation: Beaujolais-Villages Blanc, Beaujolais, France
Description: This fourth-generation family estate has produced an attractively crisp wine. With sliced apple flavors and a light, tangy structure, the wine is fruity, fresh, smooth and ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine de la Paillardière 2019  Beaujolais-Villages Blanc

Appellation: Mediterranée, France Other, France
Description: With just a touch of wood aging, this wine is ripe with lightly honeyed and caramel flavors. These contrast with wine's ripe apple flavors to give a fine fruity, lightly spicy wine. Drink from 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine des Masques 2019 Exception Chardonnay (Mediterranée)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Light and mildly toasty, this wine was partially barrel fermented and a portion put through malolactic fermentation.
