It's a gentle wine that doesn't overreach, with proportionate flavors of peach and apple, highlights of buttered nuts and a hint of popcorn. It's pleasant from start to finish.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Westmount 2019 Chardonnay (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Sicilia, Sicily & Sardinia, Italy
Description: Floral aromas of hawthorn mingle with white peach and tropical fruit in this pretty Chardonnay. The palate shows ripe yellow apple and citrus alongside crisp acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Principi di Butera 2019 Chardonnay (Sicilia)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Generous aromas of ripe pear and peach are followed by sleek stone fruit flavors. It doesn't seem to have fully come into its own.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Airfield Estates 2019 Founders Series Donald D Miller Chardonnay (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Beaujolais Blanc, Beaujolais, France
Description: Very much in a style that white Beaujolais has made its own, with spice as well as ripe, warm yellow-fruit flavors, this is a full-bodied wine. Its rich texture and light touch of acidity is immediately attractive. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Bertrand 2019  Beaujolais Blanc

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Description: This fruity and buttery wine is soft and supple, offering plenty of apple and vanilla flavors on a medium body that's balanced with modest acidity.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Josh Cellars 2019 Reserve Chardonnay (North Coast)

Appellation: Beaujolais-Villages Blanc, Beaujolais, France
Description: This ripe, creamy wine is full of yellow fruits touched by honey, with a rounded texture. Offering a rich texture and perfumed acidity, it finishes with a squeeze of lemon juice. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Lucien Lardy 2019 Chardonnay  (Beaujolais-Villages Blanc)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Generous aromas of ripe pear and peach are followed by sleek stone fruit flavors. It doesn't seem to have fully come into its own.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Airfield Estates 2019 Founders Series Donald D Miller Chardonnay (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Carneros, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Description: Bright tangy acidity makes for a crisp, cohesive entry into this vineyard-designate. The wine's midpalate takes on the creamy thickness of baked apple and a lasting taste of butter.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Pine Ridge 2017 Collines VIneyard Chardonnay (Carneros)

Appellation: Beaujolais Blanc, Beaujolais, France
Description: Ripe green fruits with touches of peach give a wine that has both freshness and a rounded texture. The fruitiness has now softened, bringing out a touch of spice and final acidity.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine du Penlois 2018 Chardonnay du Châtelard  (Beaujolais Blanc)

Appellation: Beaujolais Blanc, Beaujolais, France
Description: A honeyed, ripe and also light wine, this has a nutty flavor that complements the acidity and yellow fruits. This crisp wine is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Henry Fessy 2019  Beaujolais Blanc

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Seared orange peels, wet wool and damp clay aromas show on the slightly reductive nose of this bottling. The palate blends flavors of dried citrus rind with green and Pink Lady apples.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: La Honda Winery 2019 Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Fermentation was done in a mix of concrete egg, stainless steel and French oak puncheons. The apple flavors seem a bit dried out. Cucumber, chervil and parsley highlights bring a green-herb component into focus. The acids are moderate but proportionate.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Lachini 2018 Al di là Chardonnay (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This white is approachable and moderate in acidity, with floral aromas and an earthy underbelly. Dried herb flavors season a core of apple, pear and melon.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Buehler 2018 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: Milky aromas and buttery flavors are vivid in this medium-bodied wine, adding to the smooth, creamy texture while also having a good snap of acidity. No sulfites added.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Frey 2019 Spin Organic Chardonnay (California)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This easy, appealing, medium-bodied wine starts out with mineral and flint notes but quickly segues to ripe pear and rich baked apple on the palate, cradled in a smooth, rather soft texture.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Tortoise Creek 2018 Chardonnay (Lodi)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Old-school styling shows from the opening aromas of assertive toast and raw lumber. This fills in with fruit flavors of green apple and green berries. The impact of the barrels, about one-third of them new, simply overtakes the light fruit, and turns the finish a bit bitter.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Willamette Valley Vineyards 2018 Vintage 45 Chardonnay (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Beaujolais-Villages Blanc, Beaujolais, France
Description: This wine is all about white fruits and ripe acidity. With hints of honey and yellow fruits, it is richly flavored and ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Yohan Lardy 2019 Les Bruyères  (Beaujolais-Villages Blanc)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: With 3% Viognier, this big white is sublime and opulent on the palate in lemon meringue, baked pear and pineapple. An oaky center underscores the woody intensity amidst specks of baking spice, vanilla and toast.                      Virginie Boone
Name: The Prisoner 2018 The Snitch Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Beaujolais-Villages Blanc, Beaujolais, France
Description: Bright and fruity, this light wine has attractively fresh kiwi and lime flavors. With its touch of spice, the wine is complete and ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Victor Sornin 2019 Les Monthieux Nature  (Beaujolais-Villages Blanc)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: With 3% Viognier, this big white is sublime and opulent on the palate in lemon meringue, baked pear and pineapple. An oaky center underscores the woody intensity amidst specks of baking spice, vanilla and toast.                      Virginie Boone
Name: The Prisoner 2018 The Snitch Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Beaujolais Blanc, Beaujolais, France
Description: A ripe and smoothly textured wine, this is immediately attractive with its citrus edge and light acidity. Refreshing and creamy, it is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Dupeuble Père et Fils 2019  Beaujolais Blanc

Appellation: Beaujolais-Villages Blanc, Beaujolais, France
Description: A three-acre parcel of Chardonnay is the source of this fruity wine. With a creamy texture and flavors of melon and apricot, this warm wine is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Pascal Granger 2019 La Jacarde  (Beaujolais-Villages Blanc)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Rich, rounded flavors of vanilla cookie and marshmallow mellow along a generous opulence in this white, which is dense and layered in ripeness. A hint of acidity refreshes on the finish.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Cannonball 2018 Eleven Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Made entirely from Chardonnay in a traditional method, this sparkler is moderate in structure and acidity, with strong flavors of lemon rind, stone fruit and yeasty brioche.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Foundry 2015 Blanc de Blancs Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Beaujolais-Villages Blanc, Beaujolais, France
Description: From vines in the village of Quincié, this wine is spicy, full of ripe yellow fruits as well as tight, young acidity. The wine is crisply ready to drink. Organic.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Joncy 2019 La Cadole  (Beaujolais-Villages Blanc)

Appellation: Beaujolais-Villages Blanc, Beaujolais, France
Description: This ripe, perfumed wine has a smooth texture to balance the rich apricot flavors. The wine's light acidity and open character mean it is very ready to drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Dubost 2019  Beaujolais-Villages Blanc

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: Ripe pears and pastry spices meet a rich, mouthfilling texture in this medium-bodied wine. Oaky notes of vanilla, toast and butter give it a big personality.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Zoom Juice 2018 Chardonnay (California)

Appellation: Pago de Arínzano, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Haystack aromas are low on fruit and show a touch of chemical oak. This Navarran Chardonnay is full in body, with yellow apple flavors and mild oak.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Arínzano 2018 Hacienda de Arínzano Chardonnay (Pago de Arínzano)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: A pronounced toast and butter aroma is echoed strongly in the flavors of this full-bodied, oaky and assertive wine, mostly overshadowing the fruit flavors, but on the finish it brings in nice ginger and spiced apple.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Bogle 2018 Phantom Chardonnay (California)

Appellation: Carneros, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Description: With a bright, effusive nose of peach and apricot, this wine offers full-bodied weight and opulence on the palate. Its richness is overwhelming at times.                      Virginie Boone
Name: August Briggs 2018 Leveroni Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)
